section_list.name: MBMS SESSION START REQUEST
aoa:
This message is sent by the MCE to establish an MBMS-service-associated logical M2-connection.
Direction: MCE ? eNB.
9.2.1.1 Message Type - Section Description: The Message Type IE uniquely identifies the message being sent. It is mandatory for all messages.
CHOICE (Initiating Message, Successful Outcome, Unsuccessful Outcome, …)
9.2.3.1 MCE MBMS M2AP ID - Section Description: The MCE MBMS M2AP ID uniquely identifies the MBMS Service association over the M2 interface within the MCE.
9.2.3.3 TMGI - Section Description: The TMGI uniquely identifies the MBMS Bearer Service.

9.2.3.7 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.3.7 PLMN identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The Selected PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).

9.2.3.4 MBMS Session Identity - Section Description: The MBMS Session Identity identifies the session of an MBMS Bearer Service in E-UTRAN and is used by the UE to recognise repetitions of the session. This IE is transparent to RAN. 9.2.3.4 MBMS Session Identity IE Semantics: Coded same way as the MBMS Session Identity IE as defined in TS 29.061 [9]. 8.2 MBMS Session Start 8.2.2 Successful Operation If the MBMS SESSION START REQUEST message contains the MBMS Session Identity IE, the eNB shall use it for broadcast of the MBMS Session Identity on the air interface.

9.2.3.6 MBMS Service Area - Section Description: The MBMS Service Area IE consists of a list of one or several MBMS Service Area Identities where each MBMS Service Area Identity is frequency agnostic and can be mapped onto one or more cells. 9.2.3.6 MBMS Service Area IE Semantics: Value part coded per MBMS Service Area AVP as defined in TS 29.061 [9].

8.2 MBMS Session Start 8.2.2 Successful Operation The MCE initiates the procedure by sending an MBMS SESSION START REQUEST message. If the eNB accepts the MBMS session start request, the eNB responds with the MBMS SESSION START RESPONSE message. The eNB shall select and join the IP multicast (identified by the IP multicast address and the IP address of the multicast source as described by the TNL Information IE or, if present, the Alternative TNL Information IE) to enable the reception of MBMS data.

9.2.2.1 IP Address - Section Description: This information element is an IP address. 9.2.2.1 IP Address IE Semantics: The Radio Network Layer is not supposed to interpret the address information. It should pass it to the transport layer for interpretation. For details on the IP Address, see ref. TS 36.445 [13].

9.2.2.1 IP Address - Section Description: This information element is an IP address. 9.2.2.1 IP Address IE Semantics: The Radio Network Layer is not supposed to interpret the address information. It should pass it to the transport layer for interpretation. For details on the IP Address, see ref. TS 36.445 [13].

9.2.2.2 GTP-TEID - Section Description: This information element is the GTP Tunnel Endpoint Identifier to be used for the user plane transport between eNB and the MBMS-GW. 9.2.2.2 GTP TEID IE Semantics: For details and range, see TS 29.281 [14].

8.2 MBMS Session Start 8.2.2 Successful Operation The MCE initiates the procedure by sending an MBMS SESSION START REQUEST message. If the eNB accepts the MBMS session start request, the eNB responds with the MBMS SESSION START RESPONSE message. The eNB shall select and join the IP multicast (identified by the IP multicast address and the IP address of the multicast source as described by the TNL Information IE or, if present, the Alternative TNL Information IE) to enable the reception of MBMS data.

9.2.2.1 IP Address - Section Description: This information element is an IP address. 9.2.2.1 IP Address IE Semantics: The Radio Network Layer is not supposed to interpret the address information. It should pass it to the transport layer for interpretation. For details on the IP Address, see ref. TS 36.445 [13].

9.2.2.1 IP Address - Section Description: This information element is an IP address. 9.2.2.1 IP Address IE Semantics: The Radio Network Layer is not supposed to interpret the address information. It should pass it to the transport layer for interpretation. For details on the IP Address, see ref. TS 36.445 [13].

9.1.2 GTP DL TEID IE Semantics: Shall be set to same value as the GTP DL TEID IE of the TNL Information IE. 9.2.2.2 GTP-TEID - Section Description: This information element is the GTP Tunnel Endpoint Identifier to be used for the user plane transport between eNB and the MBMS-GW. 9.2.2.2 GTP TEID IE Semantics: For details and range, see TS 29.281 [14].

9.2.1.22 SC-PTM information - Section Description: This IE defines the SC-PTM information. 8.2 MBMS Session Start 8.2.2 Successful Operation If the MBMS SESSION START REQUEST message contains the SC-PTM information IE, the eNB shall use SC-PTM for the related MBMS service in the relevant cells. The eNB shall establish or modify the resources according to the values of the Allocation and Retention Priority IE (priority level and pre-emption indicators) and the resource situation as follows: - The eNB shall consider the priority level of the requested session, when deciding on the resource allocation. - The priority levels and the pre-emption indicators may (individually or in combination) be used to determine whether the session has to be started unconditionally and immediately. If the requested session is marked as "may trigger pre-emption" and the resource situation requires so, the eNB may trigger the pre-emption procedure which may then cause the forced release of a lower priority session which is marked as "pre-emptable". Whilst the process and the extent of the pre-emption procedure is operator-dependent, the pre-emption indicators shall be treated as follows: 1. If the Pre-emption Capability IE is set to "may trigger pre-emption", then this allocation request is allowed to trigger a pre-emption procedure. 2. If the Pre-emption Capability IE is set to "shall not trigger pre-emption", then this allocation request is not allowed to trigger a pre-emption procedure. 3. If the Pre-emption Vulnerability IE is set to "pre-emptable", then this session shall be included in the pre-emption process. 4. If the Pre-emption Vulnerability IE is set to "not pre-emptable", then this session shall not be included in the pre-emption process. 5. If the Priority Level IE is set to "no priority" the given values for the Pre-emption Capability IE and Pre-emption Vulnerability IE shall not be considered. Instead the values "shall not trigger pre-emption" and "not pre-emptable" shall prevail. - The E-UTRAN pre-emption process shall keep the following rule: E-UTRAN shall only pre-empt sessions with lower priority, in ascending order of priority.
9.2.1.22 Cell ID IE Semantics: Global ID of the cell. 9.2.1.11 E-UTRAN CGI - Section Description: This information element is used to globally identify a cell (see TS 36.401 [2]).

9.2.3.7 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.3.7 PLMN identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The Selected PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).
9.2.1.11 Cell Identity IE Semantics: The 20 leftmost bits of the Cell Identity correspond to the eNB ID (Global eNB ID IE defined in section 9.2.1.10).
9.2.1.23 MBMS E-RAB QoS parameters - Section Description: This IE defines the QoS to be applied to an MBMS E-RAB.
9.2.1.23 QCI IE Semantics: QoS Class Identifier defined in TS 23.246 [8]. Coding is specified in TS 23.203 [15].

9.2.1.23 GBR QoS Information IE Semantics: This IE applies to GBR bearers only and shall be ignored otherwise. 9.2.1.24 GBR QoS Information - Section Description: This IE indicates the maximum and guaranteed bit rates of a GBR bearer for downlink.

9.2.1.24 MBMS E-RAB Maximum Bit Rate Downlink IE Semantics: Desc.: This IE indicates the maximum downlink MBMS E-RAB Bit Rate (i.e. from the EPC to E-UTRAN) for this bearer. 9.2.1.25 Bit Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the number of bits delivered by E-UTRAN in DL within a period of time, divided by the duration of the period. It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR bearer, or an aggregated maximum bit rate. 9.2.1.25 Bit Rate IE Semantics: The unit is: bit/s

9.2.1.24 MBMS E-RAB Guaranteed Bit Rate Downlink IE Semantics: Desc.: This IE indicates the downlink guaranteed MBMS E-RAB Bit Rate (provided that there is data to deliver) from the EPC to the E-UTRAN for this bearer. 9.2.1.25 Bit Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the number of bits delivered by E-UTRAN in DL within a period of time, divided by the duration of the period. It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR bearer, or an aggregated maximum bit rate. 9.2.1.25 Bit Rate IE Semantics: The unit is: bit/s

9.2.1.26 Allocation and Retention Priority - Section Description: This IE specifies the relative importance of an MBMS E-RAB compared to other MBMS E-RABs for allocation and retention of the MBMS E-RAB. 8.2 MBMS Session Start 8.2.2 Successful Operation If the MBMS SESSION START REQUEST message contains the SC-PTM information IE, the eNB shall use SC-PTM for the related MBMS service in the relevant cells. The eNB shall establish or modify the resources according to the values of the Allocation and Retention Priority IE (priority level and pre-emption indicators) and the resource situation as follows: - The eNB shall consider the priority level of the requested session, when deciding on the resource allocation. - The priority levels and the pre-emption indicators may (individually or in combination) be used to determine whether the session has to be started unconditionally and immediately. If the requested session is marked as "may trigger pre-emption" and the resource situation requires so, the eNB may trigger the pre-emption procedure which may then cause the forced release of a lower priority session which is marked as "pre-emptable". Whilst the process and the extent of the pre-emption procedure is operator-dependent, the pre-emption indicators shall be treated as follows: 1. If the Pre-emption Capability IE is set to "may trigger pre-emption", then this allocation request is allowed to trigger a pre-emption procedure. 2. If the Pre-emption Capability IE is set to "shall not trigger pre-emption", then this allocation request is not allowed to trigger a pre-emption procedure. 3. If the Pre-emption Vulnerability IE is set to "pre-emptable", then this session shall be included in the pre-emption process. 4. If the Pre-emption Vulnerability IE is set to "not pre-emptable", then this session shall not be included in the pre-emption process. 5. If the Priority Level IE is set to "no priority" the given values for the Pre-emption Capability IE and Pre-emption Vulnerability IE shall not be considered. Instead the values "shall not trigger pre-emption" and "not pre-emptable" shall prevail. - The E-UTRAN pre-emption process shall keep the following rule: E-UTRAN shall only pre-empt sessions with lower priority, in ascending order of priority.

9.2.1.26 Priority Level IE Semantics: Desc.: This IE should be understood as the “priority of allocation and retention” (see TS 23.246 [6]). Usage: Value 15 means “no priority”. Values between 1 and 14 are ordered in decreasing order of priority, i.e. 1 is the highest and 14 the lowest. Value 0 shall be treated as a logical error if received. 8.2 MBMS Session Start 8.2.2 Successful Operation If the MBMS SESSION START REQUEST message contains the SC-PTM information IE, the eNB shall use SC-PTM for the related MBMS service in the relevant cells. The eNB shall establish or modify the resources according to the values of the Allocation and Retention Priority IE (priority level and pre-emption indicators) and the resource situation as follows: - The eNB shall consider the priority level of the requested session, when deciding on the resource allocation. - The priority levels and the pre-emption indicators may (individually or in combination) be used to determine whether the session has to be started unconditionally and immediately. If the requested session is marked as "may trigger pre-emption" and the resource situation requires so, the eNB may trigger the pre-emption procedure which may then cause the forced release of a lower priority session which is marked as "pre-emptable". Whilst the process and the extent of the pre-emption procedure is operator-dependent, the pre-emption indicators shall be treated as follows: 1. If the Pre-emption Capability IE is set to "may trigger pre-emption", then this allocation request is allowed to trigger a pre-emption procedure. 2. If the Pre-emption Capability IE is set to "shall not trigger pre-emption", then this allocation request is not allowed to trigger a pre-emption procedure. 3. If the Pre-emption Vulnerability IE is set to "pre-emptable", then this session shall be included in the pre-emption process. 4. If the Pre-emption Vulnerability IE is set to "not pre-emptable", then this session shall not be included in the pre-emption process. 5. If the Priority Level IE is set to "no priority" the given values for the Pre-emption Capability IE and Pre-emption Vulnerability IE shall not be considered. Instead the values "shall not trigger pre-emption" and "not pre-emptable" shall prevail. - The E-UTRAN pre-emption process shall keep the following rule: E-UTRAN shall only pre-empt sessions with lower priority, in ascending order of priority.
ENUMERATED (shall not trigger pre-emption, may trigger pre-emption)

9.2.1.26 Pre-emption Capability IE Semantics: This IE indicates the pre-emption capability of the request on other MBMS E-RABs. 8.2 MBMS Session Start 8.2.2 Successful Operation If the MBMS SESSION START REQUEST message contains the SC-PTM information IE, the eNB shall use SC-PTM for the related MBMS service in the relevant cells. The eNB shall establish or modify the resources according to the values of the Allocation and Retention Priority IE (priority level and pre-emption indicators) and the resource situation as follows: - The eNB shall consider the priority level of the requested session, when deciding on the resource allocation. - The priority levels and the pre-emption indicators may (individually or in combination) be used to determine whether the session has to be started unconditionally and immediately. If the requested session is marked as "may trigger pre-emption" and the resource situation requires so, the eNB may trigger the pre-emption procedure which may then cause the forced release of a lower priority session which is marked as "pre-emptable". Whilst the process and the extent of the pre-emption procedure is operator-dependent, the pre-emption indicators shall be treated as follows: 1. If the Pre-emption Capability IE is set to "may trigger pre-emption", then this allocation request is allowed to trigger a pre-emption procedure. 2. If the Pre-emption Capability IE is set to "shall not trigger pre-emption", then this allocation request is not allowed to trigger a pre-emption procedure. 3. If the Pre-emption Vulnerability IE is set to "pre-emptable", then this session shall be included in the pre-emption process. 4. If the Pre-emption Vulnerability IE is set to "not pre-emptable", then this session shall not be included in the pre-emption process. 5. If the Priority Level IE is set to "no priority" the given values for the Pre-emption Capability IE and Pre-emption Vulnerability IE shall not be considered. Instead the values "shall not trigger pre-emption" and "not pre-emptable" shall prevail. - The E-UTRAN pre-emption process shall keep the following rule: E-UTRAN shall only pre-empt sessions with lower priority, in ascending order of priority.

section_list.name: MBMS SESSION START RESPONSE
aoa:
This message is sent by the eNB to report the successful outcome of the request from the MBMS SESSION START REQUEST message.
Direction: eNB ? MCE.
9.2.1.1 Message Type - Section Description: The Message Type IE uniquely identifies the message being sent. It is mandatory for all messages.
CHOICE (Initiating Message, Successful Outcome, Unsuccessful Outcome, …)
9.2.3.1 MCE MBMS M2AP ID - Section Description: The MCE MBMS M2AP ID uniquely identifies the MBMS Service association over the M2 interface within the MCE.
9.2.3.2 eNB MBMS M2AP ID - Section Description: The eNB MBMS M2AP ID uniquely identifies the MBMS Service association over the M2 interface within the eNB.

9.2.1.7 Criticality Diagnostics - Section Description: The Criticality Diagnostics IE is sent by the eNB or the MCE when parts of a received message have not been comprehended or were missing, or if the message contained logical errors. When applicable, it contains information about which Ies were not comprehended or were missing. For further details on how to use the Criticality Diagnostics IE, (see section 10 in TS 36.413 [4]).

9.2.1.7 Procedure Code IE Semantics: Procedure Code is to be used if Criticality Diagnostics is part of Error Indication procedure, and not within the response message of the same procedure that caused the error.
ENUMERATED (initiating message, successful outcome, unsuccessful outcome)
9.2.1.7 Triggering Message IE Semantics: The Triggering Message is used only if the Criticality Diagnostics is part of Error Indication procedure.
9.2.1.7 Procedure Criticality IE Semantics: This Procedure Criticality is used for reporting the Criticality of the Triggering message (Procedure).
9.2.1.7 IE Criticality IE Semantics: The IE Criticality is used for reporting the criticality of the triggering IE. The value ‘ignore’ shall not be used.
9.2.1.7 IE ID IE Semantics: The IE ID of the not understood or missing IE.

section_list.name: MBMS SESSION START FAILURE
aoa:
This message is sent by the eNB to report the unsuccessful outcome of the request from the MBMS SESSION START REQUEST message.
Direction: eNB ? MCE.
9.2.1.1 Message Type - Section Description: The Message Type IE uniquely identifies the message being sent. It is mandatory for all messages.
CHOICE (Initiating Message, Successful Outcome, Unsuccessful Outcome, …)
9.2.3.1 MCE MBMS M2AP ID - Section Description: The MCE MBMS M2AP ID uniquely identifies the MBMS Service association over the M2 interface within the MCE.
9.2.1.2 Cause - Section Description: The purpose of the Cause IE is to indicate the reason for a particular event for the M2AP protocol.

ENUMERATED (Unknown or already allocated MCE MBMS M2AP ID, Unknown or already allocated eNB MBMS M2AP ID, Unknown or inconsistent pair of MBMS M2AP IDs, Radio resources not available, Interaction with other procedure, Unspecified, …, Invalid QoS combination, Not supported QCI value)

ENUMERATED (Transfer Syntax Error, Abstract Syntax Error (Reject), Abstract Syntax Error (Ignore and Notify), Message not Compatible with Receiver State, Semantic Error, Abstract Syntax Error (Falsely Constructed Message), Unspecified, …)
ENUMERATED (Control Processing Overload, Hardware Failure, O&M Intervention, Unspecified, …)

9.2.1.7 Criticality Diagnostics - Section Description: The Criticality Diagnostics IE is sent by the eNB or the MCE when parts of a received message have not been comprehended or were missing, or if the message contained logical errors. When applicable, it contains information about which Ies were not comprehended or were missing. For further details on how to use the Criticality Diagnostics IE, (see section 10 in TS 36.413 [4]).

9.2.1.7 Procedure Code IE Semantics: Procedure Code is to be used if Criticality Diagnostics is part of Error Indication procedure, and not within the response message of the same procedure that caused the error.
ENUMERATED (initiating message, successful outcome, unsuccessful outcome)
9.2.1.7 Triggering Message IE Semantics: The Triggering Message is used only if the Criticality Diagnostics is part of Error Indication procedure.
9.2.1.7 Procedure Criticality IE Semantics: This Procedure Criticality is used for reporting the Criticality of the Triggering message (Procedure).
9.2.1.7 IE Criticality IE Semantics: The IE Criticality is used for reporting the criticality of the triggering IE. The value ‘ignore’ shall not be used.
9.2.1.7 IE ID IE Semantics: The IE ID of the not understood or missing IE.

section_list.name: MBMS SESSION STOP REQUEST
aoa:
This message is sent by the MCE to release the corresponding MBMS E-RAB and the MBMS-service-associated logical M2-connection.
Direction: MCE ? eNB.
9.2.1.1 Message Type - Section Description: The Message Type IE uniquely identifies the message being sent. It is mandatory for all messages.
CHOICE (Initiating Message, Successful Outcome, Unsuccessful Outcome, …)
9.2.3.1 MCE MBMS M2AP ID - Section Description: The MCE MBMS M2AP ID uniquely identifies the MBMS Service association over the M2 interface within the MCE.
9.2.3.2 eNB MBMS M2AP ID - Section Description: The eNB MBMS M2AP ID uniquely identifies the MBMS Service association over the M2 interface within the eNB.

section_list.name: MBMS SESSION STOP RESPONSE
aoa:
This message is sent by the eNB to acknowledge the MBMS SESSION STOP message.
Direction: eNB ? MCE.
9.2.1.1 Message Type - Section Description: The Message Type IE uniquely identifies the message being sent. It is mandatory for all messages.
CHOICE (Initiating Message, Successful Outcome, Unsuccessful Outcome, …)
9.2.3.1 MCE MBMS M2AP ID - Section Description: The MCE MBMS M2AP ID uniquely identifies the MBMS Service association over the M2 interface within the MCE.
9.2.3.2 eNB MBMS M2AP ID - Section Description: The eNB MBMS M2AP ID uniquely identifies the MBMS Service association over the M2 interface within the eNB.

9.2.1.7 Criticality Diagnostics - Section Description: The Criticality Diagnostics IE is sent by the eNB or the MCE when parts of a received message have not been comprehended or were missing, or if the message contained logical errors. When applicable, it contains information about which Ies were not comprehended or were missing. For further details on how to use the Criticality Diagnostics IE, (see section 10 in TS 36.413 [4]).

9.2.1.7 Procedure Code IE Semantics: Procedure Code is to be used if Criticality Diagnostics is part of Error Indication procedure, and not within the response message of the same procedure that caused the error.
ENUMERATED (initiating message, successful outcome, unsuccessful outcome)
9.2.1.7 Triggering Message IE Semantics: The Triggering Message is used only if the Criticality Diagnostics is part of Error Indication procedure.
9.2.1.7 Procedure Criticality IE Semantics: This Procedure Criticality is used for reporting the Criticality of the Triggering message (Procedure).
9.2.1.7 IE Criticality IE Semantics: The IE Criticality is used for reporting the criticality of the triggering IE. The value ‘ignore’ shall not be used.
9.2.1.7 IE ID IE Semantics: The IE ID of the not understood or missing IE.

section_list.name: MBMS SCHEDULING INFORMATION
aoa:
This message is sent by the MCE to provide MCCH related information to the eNB.
Direction: MCE ? eNB.
9.2.1.1 Message Type - Section Description: The Message Type IE uniquely identifies the message being sent. It is mandatory for all messages.
CHOICE (Initiating Message, Successful Outcome, Unsuccessful Outcome, …)

9.2.1.19 MCCH Update Time - Section Description: This IE indicates the time at which the eNB shall apply the update of the MCCH as specified in TS 36.300 [3]. 9.2.1.19 MCCH Update Time IE Semantics: This IE indicates the modification period, as an absolute value, from when the MCCH update should be applied. Note: The duration of the modification period is configured in eNB and MCE. 8.4 MBMS Scheduling Information 8.4.2 Successful Operation The MCE initiates the procedure by sending the MBMS SCHEDULING INFORMATION message to the eNB. The eNB shall store the MBSFN Area Configuration Item IE, apply the MCCH update from the modification period defined in the MCCH Update Time IE, and transmit the MCCH according to the MCCH configuration for the given MBSFN area indicated by the MCE. If an empty PMCH Configuration List IE is contained in this message for an MBSFN area, the eNB shall update the content of the corresponding MCCH so as not to include PMCH related information over the corresponding MCCH. If the Modulation and Coding Scheme 2 IE is included, the eNB shall ignore the Modulation and Coding Scheme IE and use the Modulation and Coding Scheme 2 IE instead. If the received PMCH Configuration IE contains the MCH Scheduling Period Extended IE, the eNB shall take its value into account instead of the value signalled in the MCH Scheduling Period IE. If the received PMCH Configuration IE contains the MCH Scheduling Period Extended 2 IE, the eNB shall take its value into account instead of the value signalled in the MCH Scheduling Period IE. The eNB shall schedule the MBMS services in the MCCH according to the order defined in the MBMS Session List per PMCH IE. If the MBMS Suspension Notification List IE is included in this message for an MBSFN area, the eNB shall broadcast the suspension decision over the air interface from the radio frame defined by the SFN IE, until the end of the Modification Period just before the "MCCH Update Time".

8.4 MBMS Scheduling Information 8.4.2 Successful Operation The MCE initiates the procedure by sending the MBMS SCHEDULING INFORMATION message to the eNB. The eNB shall store the MBSFN Area Configuration Item IE, apply the MCCH update from the modification period defined in the MCCH Update Time IE, and transmit the MCCH according to the MCCH configuration for the given MBSFN area indicated by the MCE. If an empty PMCH Configuration List IE is contained in this message for an MBSFN area, the eNB shall update the content of the corresponding MCCH so as not to include PMCH related information over the corresponding MCCH. If the Modulation and Coding Scheme 2 IE is included, the eNB shall ignore the Modulation and Coding Scheme IE and use the Modulation and Coding Scheme 2 IE instead. If the received PMCH Configuration IE contains the MCH Scheduling Period Extended IE, the eNB shall take its value into account instead of the value signalled in the MCH Scheduling Period IE. If the received PMCH Configuration IE contains the MCH Scheduling Period Extended 2 IE, the eNB shall take its value into account instead of the value signalled in the MCH Scheduling Period IE. The eNB shall schedule the MBMS services in the MCCH according to the order defined in the MBMS Session List per PMCH IE. If the MBMS Suspension Notification List IE is included in this message for an MBSFN area, the eNB shall broadcast the suspension decision over the air interface from the radio frame defined by the SFN IE, until the end of the Modification Period just before the "MCCH Update Time".

9.2.1.8 PMCH Configuration - Section Description: This information element provided PMCH configuration related content for MCCH. 8.4 MBMS Scheduling Information 8.4.2 Successful Operation The MCE initiates the procedure by sending the MBMS SCHEDULING INFORMATION message to the eNB. The eNB shall store the MBSFN Area Configuration Item IE, apply the MCCH update from the modification period defined in the MCCH Update Time IE, and transmit the MCCH according to the MCCH configuration for the given MBSFN area indicated by the MCE. If an empty PMCH Configuration List IE is contained in this message for an MBSFN area, the eNB shall update the content of the corresponding MCCH so as not to include PMCH related information over the corresponding MCCH. If the Modulation and Coding Scheme 2 IE is included, the eNB shall ignore the Modulation and Coding Scheme IE and use the Modulation and Coding Scheme 2 IE instead. If the received PMCH Configuration IE contains the MCH Scheduling Period Extended IE, the eNB shall take its value into account instead of the value signalled in the MCH Scheduling Period IE. If the received PMCH Configuration IE contains the MCH Scheduling Period Extended 2 IE, the eNB shall take its value into account instead of the value signalled in the MCH Scheduling Period IE. The eNB shall schedule the MBMS services in the MCCH according to the order defined in the MBMS Session List per PMCH IE. If the MBMS Suspension Notification List IE is included in this message for an MBSFN area, the eNB shall broadcast the suspension decision over the air interface from the radio frame defined by the SFN IE, until the end of the Modification Period just before the "MCCH Update Time".
9.2.1.8 Allocated Subframes End IE Semantics: Encoded as the sf-AllocEnd IE in TS 36.331 [11].

9.2.1.8 Modulation and Coding Scheme IE Semantics: Encoded as the dataMCS IE in TS 36.331 [11]. 8.4 MBMS Scheduling Information 8.4.2 Successful Operation The MCE initiates the procedure by sending the MBMS SCHEDULING INFORMATION message to the eNB. The eNB shall store the MBSFN Area Configuration Item IE, apply the MCCH update from the modification period defined in the MCCH Update Time IE, and transmit the MCCH according to the MCCH configuration for the given MBSFN area indicated by the MCE. If an empty PMCH Configuration List IE is contained in this message for an MBSFN area, the eNB shall update the content of the corresponding MCCH so as not to include PMCH related information over the corresponding MCCH. If the Modulation and Coding Scheme 2 IE is included, the eNB shall ignore the Modulation and Coding Scheme IE and use the Modulation and Coding Scheme 2 IE instead. If the received PMCH Configuration IE contains the MCH Scheduling Period Extended IE, the eNB shall take its value into account instead of the value signalled in the MCH Scheduling Period IE. If the received PMCH Configuration IE contains the MCH Scheduling Period Extended 2 IE, the eNB shall take its value into account instead of the value signalled in the MCH Scheduling Period IE. The eNB shall schedule the MBMS services in the MCCH according to the order defined in the MBMS Session List per PMCH IE. If the MBMS Suspension Notification List IE is included in this message for an MBSFN area, the eNB shall broadcast the suspension decision over the air interface from the radio frame defined by the SFN IE, until the end of the Modification Period just before the "MCCH Update Time".

section_list.name: MBMS SCHEDULING INFORMATION RESPONSE
aoa:
This message is sent by the eNB to acknowledge the MBMS SCHEDULING INFORMATION message.
Direction: eNB ? MCE.
9.2.1.1 Message Type - Section Description: The Message Type IE uniquely identifies the message being sent. It is mandatory for all messages.
CHOICE (Initiating Message, Successful Outcome, Unsuccessful Outcome, …)

9.2.1.7 Criticality Diagnostics - Section Description: The Criticality Diagnostics IE is sent by the eNB or the MCE when parts of a received message have not been comprehended or were missing, or if the message contained logical errors. When applicable, it contains information about which Ies were not comprehended or were missing. For further details on how to use the Criticality Diagnostics IE, (see section 10 in TS 36.413 [4]).

9.2.1.7 Procedure Code IE Semantics: Procedure Code is to be used if Criticality Diagnostics is part of Error Indication procedure, and not within the response message of the same procedure that caused the error.
ENUMERATED (initiating message, successful outcome, unsuccessful outcome)
9.2.1.7 Triggering Message IE Semantics: The Triggering Message is used only if the Criticality Diagnostics is part of Error Indication procedure.
9.2.1.7 Procedure Criticality IE Semantics: This Procedure Criticality is used for reporting the Criticality of the Triggering message (Procedure).
9.2.1.7 IE Criticality IE Semantics: The IE Criticality is used for reporting the criticality of the triggering IE. The value ‘ignore’ shall not be used.
9.2.1.7 IE ID IE Semantics: The IE ID of the not understood or missing IE.

section_list.name: RESET
aoa:
This message is either sent by the eNB or the MCE and is used to request the M2 interface or part of M2 interface to be reset.
Direction: eNB ? MCE, MCE ? eNB
9.2.1.1 Message Type - Section Description: The Message Type IE uniquely identifies the message being sent. It is mandatory for all messages.
CHOICE (Initiating Message, Successful Outcome, Unsuccessful Outcome, …)
9.2.1.2 Cause - Section Description: The purpose of the Cause IE is to indicate the reason for a particular event for the M2AP protocol.

ENUMERATED (Unknown or already allocated MCE MBMS M2AP ID, Unknown or already allocated eNB MBMS M2AP ID, Unknown or inconsistent pair of MBMS M2AP IDs, Radio resources not available, Interaction with other procedure, Unspecified, …, Invalid QoS combination, Not supported QCI value)

ENUMERATED (Transfer Syntax Error, Abstract Syntax Error (Reject), Abstract Syntax Error (Ignore and Notify), Message not Compatible with Receiver State, Semantic Error, Abstract Syntax Error (Falsely Constructed Message), Unspecified, …)
ENUMERATED (Control Processing Overload, Hardware Failure, O&M Intervention, Unspecified, …)

8.5.2 Successful Operation 8.5.2.1 Reset Procedure Initiated from the MCE If the RESET message contains the MBMS-Service-associated logical M2-connection list IE, then: - The eNB shall use the MCE MBMS M2AP ID IE and/or the eNB MBMS M2AP ID IE to explicitly identify the MBMS service association(s) to be reset. - The eNB shall in the RESET ACKNOWLEDGE message include, for each MBMS service association to be reset, the MBMS-Service-associated logical M2-connection Item IE in the MBMS-Service-associated logical M2-connection list IE. The MBMS-Service-associated logical M2-connection Item Ies shall be in the same order as received in the RESET message and shall include also unknown MBMS-Service-associated logical M2-connections. Empty MBMS-Service-associated logical M2-connection Item Ies, received in the RESET message, may be omitted in the RESET ACKNOWLEDGE message. - If the MCE MBMS M2AP ID IE is included in the MBMS-Service-associated logical M2-connection Item IE for an MBMS service association, the eNB shall include the MCE MBMS M2AP ID IE in the corresponding MBMS-Service-associated logical M2-connection Item IE in the RESET ACKNOWLEDGE message. - If the eNB MBMS M2AP ID IE is included in an MBMS-Service-associated logical M2-connection Item IE for an MBMS service association, the eNB shall include the eNB MBMS M2AP ID IE in the corresponding MBMS-Service-associated logical M2-connection Item IE in the RESET ACKNOWLEDGE message. 8.5.2 Successful Operation 8.5.2.2 Reset Procedure Initiated from the eNB If the RESET message contains the MBMS-Service-associated logical M2-connection list IE, then: - The MCE shall use the MCE MBMS M2AP ID IE and/or the eNB MBMS M2AP ID IE to explicitly identify the MBMS service association(s) to be reset. - The MCE shall in the RESET ACKNOWLEDGE message include, for each MBMS service association to be reset, the MBMS-Service-associated logical M2-connection Item IE in the MBMS-Service-associated logical M2-connection list IE. The MBMS-Service-associated logical M2-connection Item Ies shall be in the same order as received in the RESET message and shall include also unknown MBMS-Service-associated logical M2-connections. Empty MBMS-Service-associated logical M2-connection Item Ies, received in the RESET message, may be omitted in the RESET ACKNOWLEDGE message. - If the MCE MBMS M2AP ID IE is included in the MBMS-Service-associated logical M2-connection Item IE for an MBMS service association, the MCE shall include the MCE MBMS M2AP ID IE in the corresponding MBMS-Service-associated logical M2-connection Item IE in the RESET ACKNOWLEDGE message. - If the eNB MBMS M2AP ID IE is included in an MBMS-Service-associated logical M2-connection Item IE for an MBMS service association, the MCE shall include the eNB MBMS M2AP ID IE in the corresponding MBMS-Service-associated logical M2-connection Item IE in the RESET ACKNOWLEDGE message. 8.5.3 Abnormal Conditions 8.5.3.1 Abnormal Condition at the MCE If the RESET message includes the MBMS-Service-associated logical M2-connection list IE, but neither the MCE MBMS M2AP ID IE nor the eNB MBMS M2AP ID IE is present for a MBMS-Service-associated logical M2-connection Item IE, then the MCE shall ignore the MBMS-Service-associated logical M2-connection Item IE. The MCE may return the empty MBMS-Service-associated logical M2-connection Item IE in the MBMS-Service-associated logical M2-connection list IE in the RESET ACKNOWLEDGE message. 8.5.3 Abnormal Conditions 8.5.3.2 Abnormal Condition at the eNB If the RESET message includes the MBMS-Service-associated logical M2-connection list IE, but neither the MCE MBMS M2AP ID IE nor the eNB MBMS M2AP ID IE is present for a MBMS-Service-associated logical M2-connection Item IE, then the eNB shall ignore the MBMS-Service-associated logical M2-connection Item IE. The eNB may return the empty MBMS-Service-associated logical M2-connection Item IE in the MBMS-Service-associated logical M2-connection list IE in the RESET ACKNOWLEDGE message.

Empty MBMS-Service-associated logical M2-connection Item Ies, received in the RESET message, may be omitted in the RESET ACKNOWLEDGE message. - If the MCE MBMS M2AP ID IE is included in the MBMS-Service-associated logical M2-connection Item IE for an MBMS service association, the MCE shall include the MCE MBMS M2AP ID IE in the corresponding MBMS-Service-associated logical M2-connection Item IE in the RESET ACKNOWLEDGE message. - If the eNB MBMS M2AP ID IE is included in an MBMS-Service-associated logical M2-connection Item IE for an MBMS service association, the MCE shall include the eNB MBMS M2AP ID IE in the corresponding MBMS-Service-associated logical M2-connection Item IE in the RESET ACKNOWLEDGE message. 8.5.3 Abnormal Conditions 8.5.3.1 Abnormal Condition at the MCE If the RESET message includes the MBMS-Service-associated logical M2-connection list IE, but neither the MCE MBMS M2AP ID IE nor the eNB MBMS M2AP ID IE is present for a MBMS-Service-associated logical M2-connection Item IE, then the MCE shall ignore the MBMS-Service-associated logical M2-connection Item IE. The MBMS-Service-associated logical M2-connection Item Ies shall be in the same order as received in the RESET message and shall include also unknown MBMS-Service-associated logical M2-connections. Empty MBMS-Service-associated logical M2-connection Item Ies, received in the RESET message, may be omitted in the RESET ACKNOWLEDGE message. - If the MCE MBMS M2AP ID IE is included in the MBMS-Service-associated logical M2-connection Item IE for an MBMS service association, the eNB shall include the MCE MBMS M2AP ID IE in the corresponding MBMS-Service-associated logical M2-connection Item IE in the RESET ACKNOWLEDGE message. - If the eNB MBMS M2AP ID IE is included in an MBMS-Service-associated logical M2-connection Item IE for an MBMS service association, the eNB shall include the eNB MBMS M2AP ID IE in the corresponding MBMS-Service-associated logical M2-connection Item IE in the RESET ACKNOWLEDGE message. 8.5.2 Successful Operation 8.5.2.2 Reset Procedure Initiated from the eNB If the RESET message contains the MBMS-Service-associated logical M2-connection list IE, then: - The MCE shall use the MCE MBMS M2AP ID IE and/or the eNB MBMS M2AP ID IE to explicitly identify the MBMS service association(s) to be reset. - The MCE shall in the RESET ACKNOWLEDGE message include, for each MBMS service association to be reset, the MBMS-Service-associated logical M2-connection Item IE in the MBMS-Service-associated logical M2-connection list IE. The MBMS-Service-associated logical M2-connection Item Ies shall be in the same order as received in the RESET message and shall include also unknown MBMS-Service-associated logical M2-connections. The MBMS-Service-associated logical M2-connection Item Ies shall be in the same order as received in the RESET message and shall include also unknown MBMS-Service-associated logical M2-connections. Empty MBMS-Service-associated logical M2-connection Item Ies, received in the RESET message, may be omitted in the RESET ACKNOWLEDGE message. - If the MCE MBMS M2AP ID IE is included in the MBMS-Service-associated logical M2-connection Item IE for an MBMS service association, the eNB shall include the MCE MBMS M2AP ID IE in the corresponding MBMS-Service-associated logical M2-connection Item IE in the RESET ACKNOWLEDGE message. - If the eNB MBMS M2AP ID IE is included in an MBMS-Service-associated logical M2-connection Item IE for an MBMS service association, the eNB shall include the eNB MBMS M2AP ID IE in the corresponding MBMS-Service-associated logical M2-connection Item IE in the RESET ACKNOWLEDGE message. 8.5.2 Successful Operation 8.5.2.2 Reset Procedure Initiated from the eNB If the RESET message contains the MBMS-Service-associated logical M2-connection list IE, then: - The MCE shall use the MCE MBMS M2AP ID IE and/or the eNB MBMS M2AP ID IE to explicitly identify the MBMS service association(s) to be reset. - The MCE shall in the RESET ACKNOWLEDGE message include, for each MBMS service association to be reset, the MBMS-Service-associated logical M2-connection Item IE in the MBMS-Service-associated logical M2-connection list IE. The eNB may return the empty MBMS-Service-associated logical M2-connection Item IE in the MBMS-Service-associated logical M2-connection list IE in the RESET ACKNOWLEDGE message.

9.2.1.7 Criticality Diagnostics - Section Description: The Criticality Diagnostics IE is sent by the eNB or the MCE when parts of a received message have not been comprehended or were missing, or if the message contained logical errors. When applicable, it contains information about which Ies were not comprehended or were missing. For further details on how to use the Criticality Diagnostics IE, (see section 10 in TS 36.413 [4]).

9.2.1.7 Procedure Code IE Semantics: Procedure Code is to be used if Criticality Diagnostics is part of Error Indication procedure, and not within the response message of the same procedure that caused the error.
ENUMERATED (initiating message, successful outcome, unsuccessful outcome)
9.2.1.7 Triggering Message IE Semantics: The Triggering Message is used only if the Criticality Diagnostics is part of Error Indication procedure.
9.2.1.7 Procedure Criticality IE Semantics: This Procedure Criticality is used for reporting the Criticality of the Triggering message (Procedure).
9.2.1.7 IE Criticality IE Semantics: The IE Criticality is used for reporting the criticality of the triggering IE. The value ‘ignore’ shall not be used.
9.2.1.7 IE ID IE Semantics: The IE ID of the not understood or missing IE.

section_list.name: M2 SETUP REQUEST
aoa:
This message is sent by the eNB to initiate the M2 interface instance.
Direction: eNB ? MCE.
9.2.1.1 Message Type - Section Description: The Message Type IE uniquely identifies the message being sent. It is mandatory for all messages.
CHOICE (Initiating Message, Successful Outcome, Unsuccessful Outcome, …)
9.2.1.10 Global eNB ID - Section Description: This information element is used to globally identify an eNB (see TS 36.401 [2]).

9.2.3.7 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.3.7 PLMN identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The Selected PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).
9.2.1.10 Macro eNB ID IE Semantics: Equal to the 20 leftmost bits of the Cell Identity IE contained in the E-UTRAN CGI IE (see section 9.2.1.11) of each cell served by the eNB.
9.2.1.10 Short Macro eNB ID IE Semantics: Equal to the 18 leftmost bits of the Cell Identity IE contained in the E-UTRAN CGI IE (see section 9.2.1.11) of each cell served by the eNB.
9.2.1.10 Long Macro eNB ID IE Semantics: Equal to the 21 leftmost bits of the Cell Identity IE contained in the E-UTRAN CGI IE (see section 9.2.1.11) of each cell served by the eNB.
8.6 M2 Setup 8.6.2 Successful Operation If the M2 SETUP REQUEST message contains the eNB Name IE the MCE may use this IE as a human readable name of the eNB.
9.2.1.12 eNB MBMS Configuration data Item - Section Description: This information element provides MBMS related configuration information from the eNB.
9.2.1.11 E-UTRAN CGI - Section Description: This information element is used to globally identify a cell (see TS 36.401 [2]).

9.2.3.7 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.3.7 PLMN identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The Selected PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).
9.2.1.11 Cell Identity IE Semantics: The 20 leftmost bits of the Cell Identity correspond to the eNB ID (Global eNB ID IE defined in section 9.2.1.10).

9.2.1.20 MBSFN Synchronisation Area Id - Section Description: This IE defines the MBSFN Synchronisation Area Identity as specified in TS 36.300 [3]. 9.2.1.20 MBSFN Synchronisation Area Id IE Semantics: The MBSFN Synchronisation Area is defined in TS 36.300 [3].

9.2.3.6 MBMS Service Area - Section Description: The MBMS Service Area IE consists of a list of one or several MBMS Service Area Identities where each MBMS Service Area Identity is frequency agnostic and can be mapped onto one or more cells. 9.2.3.6 MBMS Service Area IE Semantics: Value part coded per MBMS Service Area AVP as defined in TS 29.061 [9].

section_list.name: M2 SETUP RESPONSE
aoa:
This message is sent by the MCE to complete the initiation of an M2 interface instance, providing MCCH related BCCH information.
Direction: MCE ? eNB.
9.2.1.1 Message Type - Section Description: The Message Type IE uniquely identifies the message being sent. It is mandatory for all messages.
CHOICE (Initiating Message, Successful Outcome, Unsuccessful Outcome, …)
9.2.1.16 Global MCE ID - Section Description: This IE is used to globally identify an MCE.
8.6 M2 Setup 8.6.2 Successful Operation If the M2 SETUP RESPONSE message contains the MCE Name IE the eNB may use this IE as a human readable name of the MCE.
├─MCCH related BCCH Configuration data per MBSFN area
│  └─MCCH related BCCH Configuration data Item Ies

9.2.1.13 MCCH related BCCH Configuration Item - Section Description: This information element provides MCCH related BCCH configuration information to the eNB. 8.6 M2 Setup 8.6.2 Successful Operation The eNB shall broadcast the MCCH related BCCH configuration only in those cells indicated in the Cell Information List IE contained in the M2 SETUP RESPONSE message for which the Cell Reservation Info IE within the MCCH related BCCH Configuration Item IE is not set to "reserved Cell". If the M2 SETUP RESPONSE message contains the Modification Period Extended IE within the MCCH related BCCH Configuration Item IE, the eNB shall take its value into account instead of the value signalled in the Modification Period IE. If the M2 SETUP RESPONSE message contains the Repetition Period Extended IE within the MCCH related BCCH Configuration Item IE, the eNB shall take its value into account instead of the value signalled in the Repetition Period IE.
9.2.1.14 MBSFN Area Id - Section Description: This IE defines the MBSFN Area Id. 9.2.1.14 MBSFN Area Id IE Semantics: The same encoding as the mbsfn-AreaId IE specified in TS 36.331 [11].
9.2.1.13 PDCCH Length IE Semantics: This IE is encoded along the number of OFDM symbols for PDCCH as of table 6.7-1. In TS 36.211 [12].

9.2.1.13 Repetition Period IE Semantics: The same encoding as the mcch-RepetitionPeriod IE in the mcch-Config IE as specified in TS 36.331 [11]. 8.6 M2 Setup 8.6.2 Successful Operation If the M2 SETUP RESPONSE message contains the Repetition Period Extended IE within the MCCH related BCCH Configuration Item IE, the eNB shall take its value into account instead of the value signalled in the Repetition Period IE.

9.2.1.13 Repetition Period Extended IE Semantics: The same encoding as the mcch-RepetitionPeriod-v14x0 IE in the mcch-Config IE as specified in TS 36.331 [11]. If this IE is present, the value signalled in the Repetition Period IE is ignored. 8.6 M2 Setup 8.6.2 Successful Operation If the M2 SETUP RESPONSE message contains the Repetition Period Extended IE within the MCCH related BCCH Configuration Item IE, the eNB shall take its value into account instead of the value signalled in the Repetition Period IE.
9.2.1.13 Offset IE Semantics: The same encoding as the mcch-Offset in mcch-Config IE as specified in TS 36.331 [11].

9.2.1.13 Modification Period IE Semantics: The same encoding as the mcch-ModificationPeriod IE in the mcch-Config IE as specified in TS 36.331 [11]. 8.6 M2 Setup 8.6.2 Successful Operation If the M2 SETUP RESPONSE message contains the Modification Period Extended IE within the MCCH related BCCH Configuration Item IE, the eNB shall take its value into account instead of the value signalled in the Modification Period IE.
ENUMERATED (rf1, rf2, rf4, rf8, rf16, rf32, rf64, rf128, rf256, …)

9.2.1.13 Modification Period Extended IE Semantics: The same encoding as the mcch-ModificationPeriod-v14x0 IE in the mcch-Config IE as specified in TS 36.331 [11]. If this IE is present, the value signalled in the Modification Period IE is ignored. 8.6 M2 Setup 8.6.2 Successful Operation If the M2 SETUP RESPONSE message contains the Modification Period Extended IE within the MCCH related BCCH Configuration Item IE, the eNB shall take its value into account instead of the value signalled in the Modification Period IE.
9.2.1.13 Subframe Allocation Info IE Semantics: The same encoding as the sf-AllocInfo IE specified in TS 36.331 [11].
9.2.1.13 Modulation and Coding Scheme IE Semantics: The same encoding as the signallingMCS IE specified in TS 36.331 [11].

8.6 M2 Setup 8.6.2 Successful Operation The eNB shall broadcast the MCCH related BCCH configuration only in those cells indicated in the Cell Information List IE contained in the M2 SETUP RESPONSE message for which the Cell Reservation Info IE within the MCCH related BCCH Configuration Item IE is not set to "reserved Cell". If the M2 SETUP RESPONSE message contains the MCCH related BCCH Extended Configuration Data per MBSFN Area IE, the eNB shall, if supported, broadcast and store the included corresponding configuration of MBSFN area(s) and use it for the duration of the TNL association or until any further configuration update procedure is performed. The eNB shall broadcast the MCCH related BCCH extended configuration only in those cells indicated in the Cell Information List IE contained in the M2 SETUP RESPONSE message for which the Cell Reservation Info IE within the MCCH related BCCH Extended Configuration Item IE is not set to "reserved Cell".
9.2.1.11 E-UTRAN CGI - Section Description: This information element is used to globally identify a cell (see TS 36.401 [2]).

9.2.3.7 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.3.7 PLMN identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The Selected PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).
9.2.1.11 Cell Identity IE Semantics: The 20 leftmost bits of the Cell Identity correspond to the eNB ID (Global eNB ID IE defined in section 9.2.1.10).

8.6 M2 Setup 8.6.2 Successful Operation The eNB shall broadcast the MCCH related BCCH configuration only in those cells indicated in the Cell Information List IE contained in the M2 SETUP RESPONSE message for which the Cell Reservation Info IE within the MCCH related BCCH Configuration Item IE is not set to "reserved Cell". If the M2 SETUP RESPONSE message contains the MCCH related BCCH Extended Configuration Data per MBSFN Area IE, the eNB shall, if supported, broadcast and store the included corresponding configuration of MBSFN area(s) and use it for the duration of the TNL association or until any further configuration update procedure is performed. The eNB shall broadcast the MCCH related BCCH extended configuration only in those cells indicated in the Cell Information List IE contained in the M2 SETUP RESPONSE message for which the Cell Reservation Info IE within the MCCH related BCCH Extended Configuration Item IE is not set to "reserved Cell".
9.2.1.13 Subcarrier Spacing MBMS IE Semantics: Semantics along the definition of the subcarrierSpacingMBMS-r14 IE as specified in TS 36.331 [11].

9.2.1.7 Criticality Diagnostics - Section Description: The Criticality Diagnostics IE is sent by the eNB or the MCE when parts of a received message have not been comprehended or were missing, or if the message contained logical errors. When applicable, it contains information about which Ies were not comprehended or were missing. For further details on how to use the Criticality Diagnostics IE, (see section 10 in TS 36.413 [4]).

9.2.1.7 Procedure Code IE Semantics: Procedure Code is to be used if Criticality Diagnostics is part of Error Indication procedure, and not within the response message of the same procedure that caused the error.
ENUMERATED (initiating message, successful outcome, unsuccessful outcome)
9.2.1.7 Triggering Message IE Semantics: The Triggering Message is used only if the Criticality Diagnostics is part of Error Indication procedure.
9.2.1.7 Procedure Criticality IE Semantics: This Procedure Criticality is used for reporting the Criticality of the Triggering message (Procedure).
9.2.1.7 IE Criticality IE Semantics: The IE Criticality is used for reporting the criticality of the triggering IE. The value ‘ignore’ shall not be used.
9.2.1.7 IE ID IE Semantics: The IE ID of the not understood or missing IE.
└─MCCH related BCCH Extended Configuration data per MBSFN area

8.6 M2 Setup 8.6.2 Successful Operation If the M2 SETUP RESPONSE message contains the MCCH related BCCH Extended Configuration data per MBSFN area IE, the eNB shall, if supported, broadcast and store the included corresponding configuration of MBSFN area(s) and use it for the duration of the TNL association or until any further configuration update procedure is performed. The eNB shall broadcast the MCCH related BCCH extended configuration only in those cells indicated in the Cell Information List IE contained in the M2 SETUP RESPONSE message for which the Cell Reservation Info IE within the MCCH related BCCH Extended Configuration Item IE is not set to "reserved Cell".
└─MCCH related BCCH Extended Configuration data Item Ies

The eNB shall broadcast the MCCH related BCCH extended configuration only in those cells indicated in the Cell Information List IE contained in the M2 SETUP RESPONSE message for which the Cell Reservation Info IE within the MCCH related BCCH Extended Configuration Item IE is not set to "reserved Cell".

8.6 M2 Setup 8.6.2 Successful Operation The eNB shall broadcast the MCCH related BCCH configuration only in those cells indicated in the Cell Information List IE contained in the M2 SETUP RESPONSE message for which the Cell Reservation Info IE within the MCCH related BCCH Configuration Item IE is not set to "reserved Cell". 9.2.1.11 Cell Identity IE Semantics: The 20 leftmost bits of the Cell Identity correspond to the eNB ID (Global eNB ID IE defined in section 9.2.1.10).

section_list.name: M2 SETUP FAILURE
aoa:
This message is sent by the MCE to indicate non acceptance of the M2 Setup Request.
Direction: MCE ? eNB.
9.2.1.1 Message Type - Section Description: The Message Type IE uniquely identifies the message being sent. It is mandatory for all messages.
CHOICE (Initiating Message, Successful Outcome, Unsuccessful Outcome, …)
9.2.1.2 Cause - Section Description: The purpose of the Cause IE is to indicate the reason for a particular event for the M2AP protocol.

ENUMERATED (Unknown or already allocated MCE MBMS M2AP ID, Unknown or already allocated eNB MBMS M2AP ID, Unknown or inconsistent pair of MBMS M2AP IDs, Radio resources not available, Interaction with other procedure, Unspecified, …, Invalid QoS combination, Not supported QCI value)

ENUMERATED (Transfer Syntax Error, Abstract Syntax Error (Reject), Abstract Syntax Error (Ignore and Notify), Message not Compatible with Receiver State, Semantic Error, Abstract Syntax Error (Falsely Constructed Message), Unspecified, …)
ENUMERATED (Control Processing Overload, Hardware Failure, O&M Intervention, Unspecified, …)

9.2.1.15 Time to Wait - Section Description: This IE defines the minimum allowed waiting time. 8.6 M2 Setup 8.6.3 Unsuccessful Operation If the M2 SETUP FAILURE message includes the Time To Wait IE the eNB shall wait at least for the indicated time before reinitiating the M2 setup towards the same MCE.

9.2.1.7 Criticality Diagnostics - Section Description: The Criticality Diagnostics IE is sent by the eNB or the MCE when parts of a received message have not been comprehended or were missing, or if the message contained logical errors. When applicable, it contains information about which Ies were not comprehended or were missing. For further details on how to use the Criticality Diagnostics IE, (see section 10 in TS 36.413 [4]).

9.2.1.7 Procedure Code IE Semantics: Procedure Code is to be used if Criticality Diagnostics is part of Error Indication procedure, and not within the response message of the same procedure that caused the error.
ENUMERATED (initiating message, successful outcome, unsuccessful outcome)
9.2.1.7 Triggering Message IE Semantics: The Triggering Message is used only if the Criticality Diagnostics is part of Error Indication procedure.
9.2.1.7 Procedure Criticality IE Semantics: This Procedure Criticality is used for reporting the Criticality of the Triggering message (Procedure).
9.2.1.7 IE Criticality IE Semantics: The IE Criticality is used for reporting the criticality of the triggering IE. The value ‘ignore’ shall not be used.
9.2.1.7 IE ID IE Semantics: The IE ID of the not understood or missing IE.

section_list.name: ENB CONFIGURATION UPDATE
aoa:
This message is sent by the eNB to indicate that application level configuration data has changed in the eNB.
Direction: eNB ? MCE.
9.2.1.1 Message Type - Section Description: The Message Type IE uniquely identifies the message being sent. It is mandatory for all messages.
CHOICE (Initiating Message, Successful Outcome, Unsuccessful Outcome, …)

9.2.1.10 Global eNB ID - Section Description: This information element is used to globally identify an eNB (see TS 36.401 [2]). 8.7 eNB Configuration Update 8.7.2 Successful Operation The eNB initiates the procedure by sending an ENB CONFIGURATION UPDATE message to the MCE including an appropriate set of updated configuration data that it has just taken into operational use. The ENB CONFIGURATION UPDATE message may contain: - the Global eNB ID IE, - the eNB Name IE, - the eNB MBMS Configuration data per cell IE. If the Global eNB ID IE is not included in the ENB CONFIGURATION UPDATE message, the MCE shall interpret that the existing eNB ID is not changed.

9.2.3.7 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.3.7 PLMN identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The Selected PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).

8.7 eNB Configuration Update 8.7.2 Successful Operation The eNB initiates the procedure by sending an ENB CONFIGURATION UPDATE message to the MCE including an appropriate set of updated configuration data that it has just taken into operational use. The ENB CONFIGURATION UPDATE message may contain: - the Global eNB ID IE, - the eNB Name IE, - the eNB MBMS Configuration data per cell IE. If the Global eNB ID IE is not included in the ENB CONFIGURATION UPDATE message, the MCE shall interpret that the existing eNB ID is not changed.
9.2.1.10 Macro eNB ID IE Semantics: Equal to the 20 leftmost bits of the Cell Identity IE contained in the E-UTRAN CGI IE (see section 9.2.1.11) of each cell served by the eNB.
9.2.1.10 Short Macro eNB ID IE Semantics: Equal to the 18 leftmost bits of the Cell Identity IE contained in the E-UTRAN CGI IE (see section 9.2.1.11) of each cell served by the eNB.
9.2.1.10 Long Macro eNB ID IE Semantics: Equal to the 21 leftmost bits of the Cell Identity IE contained in the E-UTRAN CGI IE (see section 9.2.1.11) of each cell served by the eNB.

8.7 eNB Configuration Update 8.7.2 Successful Operation The eNB initiates the procedure by sending an ENB CONFIGURATION UPDATE message to the MCE including an appropriate set of updated configuration data that it has just taken into operational use. The ENB CONFIGURATION UPDATE message may contain: - the Global eNB ID IE, - the eNB Name IE, - the eNB MBMS Configuration data per cell IE. If the eNB Name IE is not included in the ENB CONFIGURATION UPDATE message, the MCE shall interpret that the existing eNB name, if any, is not changed. If the ENB CONFIGURATION UPDATE message contains the eNB Name IE, the MCE may use this IE as a human readable name of the eNB.

8.7 eNB Configuration Update 8.7.2 Successful Operation The eNB initiates the procedure by sending an ENB CONFIGURATION UPDATE message to the MCE including an appropriate set of updated configuration data that it has just taken into operational use. The ENB CONFIGURATION UPDATE message may contain: - the Global eNB ID IE, - the eNB Name IE, - the eNB MBMS Configuration data per cell IE.
└─eNB MBMS Configuration data per cell Item Ies

9.2.1.12 eNB MBMS Configuration data Item - Section Description: This information element provides MBMS related configuration information from the eNB. 8.7 eNB Configuration Update 8.7.2 Successful Operation The eNB may update the configured MBMS Services Areas and the MBSFN Synchronisation Area per cell: - If the eNB includes the E-UTRAN CGI IE for a cell within the ENB CONFIGURATION UPDATE message, the MCE shall assume that the eNB does neither broadcast MCCH related configuration in the BCCH nor any MBMS service data in that cell any more. - If the eNB includes the eNB MBMS Configuration data Item IE for a cell within the ENB CONFIGURATION UPDATE message, the MCE may decide to include in the ENB CONFIGURATION UPDATE ACKNOWLEDGE message the MCCH related BCCH configuration or the MCCH related BCCH extended configuration for the related MBSFN area(s).

9.2.1.11 E-UTRAN CGI - Section Description: This information element is used to globally identify a cell (see TS 36.401 [2]). 8.7 eNB Configuration Update 8.7.2 Successful Operation The eNB may update the configured MBMS Services Areas and the MBSFN Synchronisation Area per cell: - If the eNB includes the E-UTRAN CGI IE for a cell within the ENB CONFIGURATION UPDATE message, the MCE shall assume that the eNB does neither broadcast MCCH related configuration in the BCCH nor any MBMS service data in that cell any more. - If the eNB includes the eNB MBMS Configuration data Item IE for a cell within the ENB CONFIGURATION UPDATE message, the MCE may decide to include in the ENB CONFIGURATION UPDATE ACKNOWLEDGE message the MCCH related BCCH configuration or the MCCH related BCCH extended configuration for the related MBSFN area(s).

9.2.1.11 Cell Identity IE Semantics: The 20 leftmost bits of the Cell Identity correspond to the eNB ID (Global eNB ID IE defined in section 9.2.1.10).

9.2.1.20 MBSFN Synchronisation Area Id - Section Description: This IE defines the MBSFN Synchronisation Area Identity as specified in TS 36.300 [3]. 9.2.1.20 MBSFN Synchronisation Area Id IE Semantics: The MBSFN Synchronisation Area is defined in TS 36.300 [3].

9.2.3.6 MBMS Service Area - Section Description: The MBMS Service Area IE consists of a list of one or several MBMS Service Area Identities where each MBMS Service Area Identity is frequency agnostic and can be mapped onto one or more cells. 9.2.3.6 MBMS Service Area IE Semantics: Value part coded per MBMS Service Area AVP as defined in TS 29.061 [9].

9.2.1.11 E-UTRAN CGI - Section Description: This information element is used to globally identify a cell (see TS 36.401 [2]). 8.7 eNB Configuration Update 8.7.2 Successful Operation The eNB may update the configured MBMS Services Areas and the MBSFN Synchronisation Area per cell: - If the eNB includes the E-UTRAN CGI IE for a cell within the ENB CONFIGURATION UPDATE message, the MCE shall assume that the eNB does neither broadcast MCCH related configuration in the BCCH nor any MBMS service data in that cell any more. - If the eNB includes the eNB MBMS Configuration data Item IE for a cell within the ENB CONFIGURATION UPDATE message, the MCE may decide to include in the ENB CONFIGURATION UPDATE ACKNOWLEDGE message the MCCH related BCCH configuration or the MCCH related BCCH extended configuration for the related MBSFN area(s).

9.2.1.11 Cell Identity IE Semantics: The 20 leftmost bits of the Cell Identity correspond to the eNB ID (Global eNB ID IE defined in section 9.2.1.10).

section_list.name: ENB CONFIGURATION UPDATE ACKNOWLEDGE
aoa:
This message acknowledges the ENB CONFIGURATION UPDATE message.
Direction: MCE ? eNB.
9.2.1.1 Message Type - Section Description: The Message Type IE uniquely identifies the message being sent. It is mandatory for all messages.
CHOICE (Initiating Message, Successful Outcome, Unsuccessful Outcome, …)
├─MCCH related BCCH Configuration data per MBSFN area
│  └─MCCH related BCCH Configuration data Item Ies

9.2.1.13 MCCH related BCCH Configuration Item - Section Description: This information element provides MCCH related BCCH configuration information to the eNB. 8.7 eNB Configuration Update 8.7.2 Successful Operation If the ENB CONFIGURATION UPDATE ACKNOWLEDGE message contains the Cell Information List IE within the MCCH related BCCH Configuration Item IE or within the MCCH related BCCH Extended Configuration Item IE, the eNB shall broadcast that MCCH related BCCH configuration only in those cells indicated in the IE for which the Cell Reservation Info IE is not set to "reservedCell". If the ENB CONFIGURATION UPDATE ACKNOWLEDGE message does not contain the Cell Information List IE within the MCCH related BCCH Configuration Item IE or within the MCCH related BCCH Extended Configuration Item IE, the eNB shall not broadcast that MCCH related BCCH configuration in any cell. If the ENB CONFIGURATION UPDATE ACKNOWLEDGE message contains the Modification Period Extended IE within the MCCH related BCCH Configuration Item IE, the eNB shall take its value into account instead of the value signalled in the Modification Period IE. If the ENB CONFIGURATION UPDATE ACKNOWLEDGE message contains the Repetition Period Extended IE within the MCCH related BCCH Configuration Item IE, the eNB shall take its value into account instead of the value signalled in the Repetition Period IE. If the ENB CONFIGURATION UPDATE ACKNOWLEDGE message does not contain the MCCH related BCCH Configuration Item IE or the MCCH related BCCH Extended Configuration Item IE for an existing MBSFN area, the eNB shall interpret that the corresponding configuration data for that MBSFN area is not changed and shall continue to operate the M2 with the existing related configuration data for that MBSFN area.

If the ENB CONFIGURATION UPDATE ACKNOWLEDGE message contains the Modification Period Extended IE within the MCCH related BCCH Configuration Item IE, the eNB shall take its value into account instead of the value signalled in the Modification Period IE. If the ENB CONFIGURATION UPDATE ACKNOWLEDGE message contains the Repetition Period Extended IE within the MCCH related BCCH Configuration Item IE, the eNB shall take its value into account instead of the value signalled in the Repetition Period IE. If the ENB CONFIGURATION UPDATE ACKNOWLEDGE message does not contain the MCCH related BCCH Configuration Item IE or the MCCH related BCCH Extended Configuration Item IE for an existing MBSFN area, the eNB shall interpret that the corresponding configuration data for that MBSFN area is not changed and shall continue to operate the M2 with the existing related configuration data for that MBSFN area.

If the ENB CONFIGURATION UPDATE ACKNOWLEDGE message contains the Repetition Period Extended IE within the MCCH related BCCH Configuration Item IE, the eNB shall take its value into account instead of the value signalled in the Repetition Period IE. If the ENB CONFIGURATION UPDATE ACKNOWLEDGE message contains the Repetition Period Extended IE within the MCCH related BCCH Configuration Item IE, the eNB shall take its value into account instead of the value signalled in the Repetition Period IE. If the ENB CONFIGURATION UPDATE ACKNOWLEDGE message does not contain the MCCH related BCCH Configuration Item IE or the MCCH related BCCH Extended Configuration Item IE for an existing MBSFN area, the eNB shall interpret that the corresponding configuration data for that MBSFN area is not changed and shall continue to operate the M2 with the existing related configuration data for that MBSFN area.

9.2.3.7 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.3.7 PLMN identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The Selected PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).

section_list.name: ENB CONFIGURATION UPDATE FAILURE
aoa:
This message is sent by the MCE to indicate non acceptance of the eNB Configuration Update.
Direction: MCE ? eNB.
9.2.1.1 Message Type - Section Description: The Message Type IE uniquely identifies the message being sent. It is mandatory for all messages.
CHOICE (Initiating Message, Successful Outcome, Unsuccessful Outcome, …)
9.2.1.2 Cause - Section Description: The purpose of the Cause IE is to indicate the reason for a particular event for the M2AP protocol.

ENUMERATED (Unknown or already allocated MCE MBMS M2AP ID, Unknown or already allocated eNB MBMS M2AP ID, Unknown or inconsistent pair of MBMS M2AP IDs, Radio resources not available, Interaction with other procedure, Unspecified, …, Invalid QoS combination, Not supported QCI value)

ENUMERATED (Transfer Syntax Error, Abstract Syntax Error (Reject), Abstract Syntax Error (Ignore and Notify), Message not Compatible with Receiver State, Semantic Error, Abstract Syntax Error (Falsely Constructed Message), Unspecified, …)
ENUMERATED (Control Processing Overload, Hardware Failure, O&M Intervention, Unspecified, …)

9.2.1.15 Time to Wait - Section Description: This IE defines the minimum allowed waiting time. 8.7 eNB Configuration Update 8.7.3 Unsuccessful Operation If the ENB CONFIGURATION UPDATE FAILURE message includes the Time To Wait IE the eNB shall wait at least for the indicated time before reinitiating the ENB Configuration Update procedure towards the MCE. Both nodes shall continue to operate the M2 interface with their respective configuration data.

9.2.1.7 Criticality Diagnostics - Section Description: The Criticality Diagnostics IE is sent by the eNB or the MCE when parts of a received message have not been comprehended or were missing, or if the message contained logical errors. When applicable, it contains information about which Ies were not comprehended or were missing. For further details on how to use the Criticality Diagnostics IE, (see section 10 in TS 36.413 [4]).

9.2.1.7 Procedure Code IE Semantics: Procedure Code is to be used if Criticality Diagnostics is part of Error Indication procedure, and not within the response message of the same procedure that caused the error.
ENUMERATED (initiating message, successful outcome, unsuccessful outcome)
9.2.1.7 Triggering Message IE Semantics: The Triggering Message is used only if the Criticality Diagnostics is part of Error Indication procedure.
9.2.1.7 Procedure Criticality IE Semantics: This Procedure Criticality is used for reporting the Criticality of the Triggering message (Procedure).
9.2.1.7 IE Criticality IE Semantics: The IE Criticality is used for reporting the criticality of the triggering IE. The value ‘ignore’ shall not be used.
9.2.1.7 IE ID IE Semantics: The IE ID of the not understood or missing IE.

section_list.name: MCE CONFIGURATION UPDATE
aoa:
This message is sent by the MCE to indicate that application level configuration data has changed in the MCE.
Direction: MCE ? eNB.
9.2.1.1 Message Type - Section Description: The Message Type IE uniquely identifies the message being sent. It is mandatory for all messages.
CHOICE (Initiating Message, Successful Outcome, Unsuccessful Outcome, …)

9.2.1.16 Global MCE ID - Section Description: This IE is used to globally identify an MCE. 8.8 MCE Configuration Update 8.8.2 Successful Operation The MCE initiates the procedure by sending an MCE CONFIGURATION UPDATE message to the eNB including an appropriate set of updated configuration data. The MCE CONFIGURATION UPDATE message may contain: - the Global MCE ID IE, - the MCE Name IE, - the MCCH related BCCH Configuration data per MBSFN area IE. If the Global MCE ID IE is not included in the MCE CONFIGURATION UPDATE message, the eNB shall interpret that the existing MCE ID is not changed.

8.8 MCE Configuration Update 8.8.2 Successful Operation The MCE initiates the procedure by sending an MCE CONFIGURATION UPDATE message to the eNB including an appropriate set of updated configuration data. The MCE CONFIGURATION UPDATE message may contain: - the Global MCE ID IE, - the MCE Name IE, - the MCCH related BCCH Configuration data per MBSFN area IE. If the Global MCE ID IE is not included in the MCE CONFIGURATION UPDATE message, the eNB shall interpret that the existing MCE ID is not changed.

8.8 MCE Configuration Update 8.8.2 Successful Operation The MCE initiates the procedure by sending an MCE CONFIGURATION UPDATE message to the eNB including an appropriate set of updated configuration data. The MCE CONFIGURATION UPDATE message may contain: - the Global MCE ID IE, - the MCE Name IE, - the MCCH related BCCH Configuration data per MBSFN area IE. If the MCE Name IE is not included in the MCE CONFIGURATION UPDATE message, the eNB shall interpret that the existing MCE name, if any, is not changed. If the MCE CONFIGURATION UPDATE message contains the MCE Name IE, the eNB may use this IE as a human readable name of the MCE.
├─MCCH related BCCH Configuration data per MBSFN area

8.8 MCE Configuration Update 8.8.2 Successful Operation The MCE initiates the procedure by sending an MCE CONFIGURATION UPDATE message to the eNB including an appropriate set of updated configuration data. The MCE CONFIGURATION UPDATE message may contain: - the Global MCE ID IE, - the MCE Name IE, - the MCCH related BCCH Configuration data per MBSFN area IE.
│  └─MCCH related BCCH Configuration data Item Ies

9.2.1.13 MCCH related BCCH Configuration Item - Section Description: This information element provides MCCH related BCCH configuration information to the eNB. 8.8 MCE Configuration Update 8.8.2 Successful Operation If the MCE CONFIGURATION UPDATE message contains the Cell Information List IE within the MCCH related BCCH Configuration Item IE, or within the MCCH related BCCH Extended Configuration Item IE, the eNB shall broadcast that MCCH related BCCH configuration only in those cells indicated in the IE for which the Cell Reservation Info IE is not set to "reservedCell". If the MCE CONFIGURATION UPDATE message does not contain the Cell Information List IE within the MCCH related BCCH Configuration Item IE, or within the MCCH related BCCH Extended Configuration Item IE, the eNB shall not broadcast that MCCH related BCCH configuration in any cell. If the MCE CONFIGURATION UPDATE message contains the Modification Period Extended IE within the MCCH related BCCH Confiruation Item IE, the eNB shall take its value into account instead of the value signalled in the Modification Period IE. If the MCE CONFIGURATION UPDATE message contains the Repetition Period Extended IE within the MCCH related BCCH Confiruation Item IE, the eNB shall take its value into account instead of the value signalled in the Repetition Period IE. If the MCE CONFIGURATION UPDATE message does not contain the MCCH related BCCH Configuration Item IE, or the MCCH related BCCH Extended Configuration Item IE, for an existing MBSFN area, the eNB shall interpret that the corresponding configuration data for that MBSFN area is not changed and shall continue to operate the M2 with the existing related configuration data for that MBSFN area.
