9.2.1.27 Repetition Period Expanded IE Semantics: The same encoding as the mcch-RepetitionPeriod-r16 IE in the mcch-Config-r16 IE as specified in TS 36.331 [11].
9.2.1.27 Offset IE Semantics: The same encoding as the mcch-Offset-r16 IE in the mcch-Config-r16 IE as specified in TS 36.331 [11].
ENUMERATED (rf1, rf2, rf4, rf8, rf16, rf32, rf64, rf128, rf256, rf512, rf1024, …)
9.2.1.27 Modification Period Expanded IE Semantics: The same encoding as the mcch-ModificationPeriod-r16 IE in the mcch-Config-r16 IE as specified in TS 36.331 [11].
9.2.1.27 Subframe Allocation Info Expanded IE Semantics: The same encoding as the sf-AllocInfo-r16 IE in the mcch-Config-r16 IE as specified in TS 36.331 [11].
9.2.1.27 Modulation and Coding Scheme IE Semantics: The same encoding as the signallingMCS-r16 IE in the mcch-Config-r16 IE as specified in TS 36.331 [11].
9.2.1.27 Subcarrier Spacing MBMS Expanded IE Semantics: The same encoding as the subcarrierSpacingMBMS-r16 IE in the mcch-Config-r16 IE as specified in TS 36.331 [11].
9.2.1.27 Time separation IE Semantics: The same encoding as the timeSeparation-r16 IE in the mcch-Config-r16 IE as specified in TS 36.331 [11].

8.8 MCE Configuration Update 8.8.2 Successful Operation If the MCE CONFIGURATION UPDATE message contains the Cell Information List IE within the MCCH related BCCH Configuration Item IE, or within the MCCH related BCCH Extended Configuration Item IE, the eNB shall broadcast that MCCH related BCCH configuration only in those cells indicated in the IE for which the Cell Reservation Info IE is not set to "reservedCell". If the MCE CONFIGURATION UPDATE message does not contain the Cell Information List IE within the MCCH related BCCH Configuration Item IE, or within the MCCH related BCCH Extended Configuration Item IE, the eNB shall not broadcast that MCCH related BCCH configuration in any cell. If the MCE CONFIGURATION UPDATE message contains the Modification Period Extended IE within the MCCH related BCCH Confiruation Item IE, the eNB shall take its value into account instead of the value signalled in the Modification Period IE. If the MCE CONFIGURATION UPDATE message contains the Repetition Period Extended IE within the MCCH related BCCH Confiruation Item IE, the eNB shall take its value into account instead of the value signalled in the Repetition Period IE. If the MCE CONFIGURATION UPDATE message does not contain the MCCH related BCCH Configuration Item IE, or the MCCH related BCCH Extended Configuration Item IE, for an existing MBSFN area, the eNB shall interpret that the corresponding configuration data for that MBSFN area is not changed and shall continue to operate the M2 with the existing related configuration data for that MBSFN area.
9.2.1.11 E-UTRAN CGI - Section Description: This information element is used to globally identify a cell (see TS 36.401 [2]).

9.2.3.7 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.3.7 PLMN identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The Selected PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).
9.2.1.11 Cell Identity IE Semantics: The 20 leftmost bits of the Cell Identity correspond to the eNB ID (Global eNB ID IE defined in section 9.2.1.10).

8.8 MCE Configuration Update 8.8.2 Successful Operation If the MCE CONFIGURATION UPDATE message contains the Cell Information List IE within the MCCH related BCCH Configuration Item IE, or within the MCCH related BCCH Extended Configuration Item IE, the eNB shall broadcast that MCCH related BCCH configuration only in those cells indicated in the IE for which the Cell Reservation Info IE is not set to "reservedCell". If the MCE CONFIGURATION UPDATE message does not contain the Cell Information List IE within the MCCH related BCCH Configuration Item IE, or within the MCCH related BCCH Extended Configuration Item IE, the eNB shall not broadcast that MCCH related BCCH configuration in any cell. If the MCE CONFIGURATION UPDATE message contains the Modification Period Extended IE within the MCCH related BCCH Confiruation Item IE, the eNB shall take its value into account instead of the value signalled in the Modification Period IE. If the MCE CONFIGURATION UPDATE message contains the Repetition Period Extended IE within the MCCH related BCCH Confiruation Item IE, the eNB shall take its value into account instead of the value signalled in the Repetition Period IE. If the MCE CONFIGURATION UPDATE message does not contain the MCCH related BCCH Configuration Item IE, or the MCCH related BCCH Extended Configuration Item IE, for an existing MBSFN area, the eNB shall interpret that the corresponding configuration data for that MBSFN area is not changed and shall continue to operate the M2 with the existing related configuration data for that MBSFN area.

section_list.name: MCE CONFIGURATION UPDATE ACKNOWLEDGE
aoa:
This message acknowledges the MCE CONFIGURATION UPDATE message.
Direction: eNB ? MCE.
9.2.1.1 Message Type - Section Description: The Message Type IE uniquely identifies the message being sent. It is mandatory for all messages.
CHOICE (Initiating Message, Successful Outcome, Unsuccessful Outcome, …)

9.2.1.7 Criticality Diagnostics - Section Description: The Criticality Diagnostics IE is sent by the eNB or the MCE when parts of a received message have not been comprehended or were missing, or if the message contained logical errors. When applicable, it contains information about which Ies were not comprehended or were missing. For further details on how to use the Criticality Diagnostics IE, (see section 10 in TS 36.413 [4]).

9.2.1.7 Procedure Code IE Semantics: Procedure Code is to be used if Criticality Diagnostics is part of Error Indication procedure, and not within the response message of the same procedure that caused the error.
ENUMERATED (initiating message, successful outcome, unsuccessful outcome)
9.2.1.7 Triggering Message IE Semantics: The Triggering Message is used only if the Criticality Diagnostics is part of Error Indication procedure.
9.2.1.7 Procedure Criticality IE Semantics: This Procedure Criticality is used for reporting the Criticality of the Triggering message (Procedure).
9.2.1.7 IE Criticality IE Semantics: The IE Criticality is used for reporting the criticality of the triggering IE. The value ‘ignore’ shall not be used.
9.2.1.7 IE ID IE Semantics: The IE ID of the not understood or missing IE.

section_list.name: MCE CONFIGURATION UPDATE FAILURE
aoa:
This message is sent by the eNB to indicate non acceptance of the MCE Configuration Update.
Direction: eNB ? MCE.
9.2.1.1 Message Type - Section Description: The Message Type IE uniquely identifies the message being sent. It is mandatory for all messages.
CHOICE (Initiating Message, Successful Outcome, Unsuccessful Outcome, …)
9.2.1.2 Cause - Section Description: The purpose of the Cause IE is to indicate the reason for a particular event for the M2AP protocol.

ENUMERATED (Unknown or already allocated MCE MBMS M2AP ID, Unknown or already allocated eNB MBMS M2AP ID, Unknown or inconsistent pair of MBMS M2AP IDs, Radio resources not available, Interaction with other procedure, Unspecified, …, Invalid QoS combination, Not supported QCI value)

ENUMERATED (Transfer Syntax Error, Abstract Syntax Error (Reject), Abstract Syntax Error (Ignore and Notify), Message not Compatible with Receiver State, Semantic Error, Abstract Syntax Error (Falsely Constructed Message), Unspecified, …)
ENUMERATED (Control Processing Overload, Hardware Failure, O&M Intervention, Unspecified, …)

9.2.1.15 Time to Wait - Section Description: This IE defines the minimum allowed waiting time. 8.8 MCE Configuration Update 8.8.3 Unsuccessful Operation If the MCE CONFIGURATION UPDATE FAILURE message includes the Time To Wait IE the MCE shall wait at least for the indicated time before reinitiating the MCE Configuration Update procedure towards the eNB. Both nodes shall continue to operate the M2 interface with their respective configuration data.

9.2.1.7 Criticality Diagnostics - Section Description: The Criticality Diagnostics IE is sent by the eNB or the MCE when parts of a received message have not been comprehended or were missing, or if the message contained logical errors. When applicable, it contains information about which Ies were not comprehended or were missing. For further details on how to use the Criticality Diagnostics IE, (see section 10 in TS 36.413 [4]).

9.2.1.7 Procedure Code IE Semantics: Procedure Code is to be used if Criticality Diagnostics is part of Error Indication procedure, and not within the response message of the same procedure that caused the error.
ENUMERATED (initiating message, successful outcome, unsuccessful outcome)
9.2.1.7 Triggering Message IE Semantics: The Triggering Message is used only if the Criticality Diagnostics is part of Error Indication procedure.
9.2.1.7 Procedure Criticality IE Semantics: This Procedure Criticality is used for reporting the Criticality of the Triggering message (Procedure).
9.2.1.7 IE Criticality IE Semantics: The IE Criticality is used for reporting the criticality of the triggering IE. The value ‘ignore’ shall not be used.
9.2.1.7 IE ID IE Semantics: The IE ID of the not understood or missing IE.

section_list.name: ERROR INDICATION
aoa:
This message is sent by both the MCE and the eNB and is used to indicate that some error has been detected in the node.
Direction: MCE ? eNB and eNB ? MCE.
9.2.1.1 Message Type - Section Description: The Message Type IE uniquely identifies the message being sent. It is mandatory for all messages.
CHOICE (Initiating Message, Successful Outcome, Unsuccessful Outcome, …)

9.2.3.1 MCE MBMS M2AP ID - Section Description: The MCE MBMS M2AP ID uniquely identifies the MBMS Service association over the M2 interface within the MCE. 8.9 Error Indication 8.9.2 Successful Operation In case the Error Indication procedure is triggered by utilising MBMS-service-associated signalling the MCE MBMS M2AP ID IE and the eNB MBMS M2AP ID IE shall be included in the ERROR INDICATION message. If one or both of MCE MBMS M2AP ID IE and the eNB MBMS M2AP ID IE are not correct, the cause shall be set to appropriate value e.g. "Unknown or already allocated MCE MBMS M2AP ID", "Unknown or already allocated eNB MBMS M2AP ID" or "Unknown or inconsistent pair of MBMS M2AP ID".

9.2.3.2 eNB MBMS M2AP ID - Section Description: The eNB MBMS M2AP ID uniquely identifies the MBMS Service association over the M2 interface within the eNB. 8.9 Error Indication 8.9.2 Successful Operation In case the Error Indication procedure is triggered by utilising MBMS-service-associated signalling the MCE MBMS M2AP ID IE and the eNB MBMS M2AP ID IE shall be included in the ERROR INDICATION message. If one or both of MCE MBMS M2AP ID IE and the eNB MBMS M2AP ID IE are not correct, the cause shall be set to appropriate value e.g. "Unknown or already allocated MCE MBMS M2AP ID", "Unknown or already allocated eNB MBMS M2AP ID" or "Unknown or inconsistent pair of MBMS M2AP ID".

9.2.1.2 Cause - Section Description: The purpose of the Cause IE is to indicate the reason for a particular event for the M2AP protocol. 8.9 Error Indication 8.9.2 Successful Operation The ERROR INDICATION message shall contain at least either the Cause IE or the Criticality Diagnostics IE.

ENUMERATED (Unknown or already allocated MCE MBMS M2AP ID, Unknown or already allocated eNB MBMS M2AP ID, Unknown or inconsistent pair of MBMS M2AP IDs, Radio resources not available, Interaction with other procedure, Unspecified, …, Invalid QoS combination, Not supported QCI value)

ENUMERATED (Transfer Syntax Error, Abstract Syntax Error (Reject), Abstract Syntax Error (Ignore and Notify), Message not Compatible with Receiver State, Semantic Error, Abstract Syntax Error (Falsely Constructed Message), Unspecified, …)
ENUMERATED (Control Processing Overload, Hardware Failure, O&M Intervention, Unspecified, …)

9.2.1.7 Criticality Diagnostics - Section Description: The Criticality Diagnostics IE is sent by the eNB or the MCE when parts of a received message have not been comprehended or were missing, or if the message contained logical errors. When applicable, it contains information about which Ies were not comprehended or were missing. For further details on how to use the Criticality Diagnostics IE, (see section 10 in TS 36.413 [4]). 8.9 Error Indication 8.9.2 Successful Operation The ERROR INDICATION message shall contain at least either the Cause IE or the Criticality Diagnostics IE.

9.2.1.7 Procedure Code IE Semantics: Procedure Code is to be used if Criticality Diagnostics is part of Error Indication procedure, and not within the response message of the same procedure that caused the error.
ENUMERATED (initiating message, successful outcome, unsuccessful outcome)
9.2.1.7 Triggering Message IE Semantics: The Triggering Message is used only if the Criticality Diagnostics is part of Error Indication procedure.
9.2.1.7 Procedure Criticality IE Semantics: This Procedure Criticality is used for reporting the Criticality of the Triggering message (Procedure).
9.2.1.7 IE Criticality IE Semantics: The IE Criticality is used for reporting the criticality of the triggering IE. The value ‘ignore’ shall not be used.
9.2.1.7 IE ID IE Semantics: The IE ID of the not understood or missing IE.

section_list.name: MBMS SESSION UPDATE REQUEST
aoa:
This message is sent by the MCE to the eNB in order to inform of the change of session characteristics e.g. service area of one MBMS service session.
Direction: MCE ? eNB.
9.2.1.1 Message Type - Section Description: The Message Type IE uniquely identifies the message being sent. It is mandatory for all messages.
CHOICE (Initiating Message, Successful Outcome, Unsuccessful Outcome, …)
9.2.3.1 MCE MBMS M2AP ID - Section Description: The MCE MBMS M2AP ID uniquely identifies the MBMS Service association over the M2 interface within the MCE.
9.2.3.2 eNB MBMS M2AP ID - Section Description: The eNB MBMS M2AP ID uniquely identifies the MBMS Service association over the M2 interface within the eNB.
9.2.3.3 TMGI - Section Description: The TMGI uniquely identifies the MBMS Bearer Service.

9.2.3.7 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.3.7 PLMN identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The Selected PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).

9.2.3.4 MBMS Session Identity - Section Description: The MBMS Session Identity identifies the session of an MBMS Bearer Service in E-UTRAN and is used by the UE to recognise repetitions of the session. This IE is transparent to RAN. 9.2.3.4 MBMS Session Identity IE Semantics: Coded same way as the MBMS Session Identity IE as defined in TS 29.061 [9]. 8.10 MBMS Session Update 8.10.2 Successful Operation If the MBMS SESSION UPDATE REQUEST message contains the MBMS Session Identity IE for an MBMS service, the eNB shall ignore the contained information.

9.2.3.6 MBMS Service Area - Section Description: The MBMS Service Area IE consists of a list of one or several MBMS Service Area Identities where each MBMS Service Area Identity is frequency agnostic and can be mapped onto one or more cells. 9.2.3.6 MBMS Service Area IE Semantics: Value part coded per MBMS Service Area AVP as defined in TS 29.061 [9]. 8.10 MBMS Session Update 8.10.2 Successful Operation If the MBMS Service Area IE is included in the MBMS SESSION UPDATE REQUEST message, the eNB shall check the involvement of its cells in the new service area, update correspondingly the MBMS context and resources, join or leave the IP multicast if needed and send the MBMS SESSION UPDATE RESPONSE message.
8.10 MBMS Session Update 8.10.2 Successful Operation If the TNL Information IE is included in the MBMS SESSION UPDATE REQUEST message, the eNB shall ignore the contained information.

9.2.2.1 IP Address - Section Description: This information element is an IP address. 9.2.2.1 IP Address IE Semantics: The Radio Network Layer is not supposed to interpret the address information. It should pass it to the transport layer for interpretation. For details on the IP Address, see ref. TS 36.445 [13].

9.2.2.1 IP Address - Section Description: This information element is an IP address. 9.2.2.1 IP Address IE Semantics: The Radio Network Layer is not supposed to interpret the address information. It should pass it to the transport layer for interpretation. For details on the IP Address, see ref. TS 36.445 [13].

9.2.2.2 GTP-TEID - Section Description: This information element is the GTP Tunnel Endpoint Identifier to be used for the user plane transport between eNB and the MBMS-GW. 9.2.2.2 GTP TEID IE Semantics: For details and range, see TS 29.281 [14].

9.2.1.22 SC-PTM information - Section Description: This IE defines the SC-PTM information. 8.10 MBMS Session Update 8.10.2 Successful Operation If the MBMS SESSION UPDATE REQUEST message contains the SC-PTM information IE, the eNB shall check the SC-PTM related involvement of its cells in the new list of Cell identities, update correspondingly the MBMS context and resources, join or leave the IP multicast if needed and send the MBMS SESSION UPDATE RESPONSE message. If the ARP parameter is updated, the corresponding update of resources shall follow the principles described for the MBMS Session Start procedure. The eNB shall provide the MBMS session only in those cells included in the new list of Cell identities.
9.2.1.22 Cell ID IE Semantics: Global ID of the cell. 9.2.1.11 E-UTRAN CGI - Section Description: This information element is used to globally identify a cell (see TS 36.401 [2]).

9.2.3.7 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.3.7 PLMN identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The Selected PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).
9.2.1.11 Cell Identity IE Semantics: The 20 leftmost bits of the Cell Identity correspond to the eNB ID (Global eNB ID IE defined in section 9.2.1.10).
9.2.1.23 MBMS E-RAB QoS parameters - Section Description: This IE defines the QoS to be applied to an MBMS E-RAB.
9.2.1.23 QCI IE Semantics: QoS Class Identifier defined in TS 23.246 [8]. Coding is specified in TS 23.203 [15].

9.2.1.23 GBR QoS Information IE Semantics: This IE applies to GBR bearers only and shall be ignored otherwise. 9.2.1.24 GBR QoS Information - Section Description: This IE indicates the maximum and guaranteed bit rates of a GBR bearer for downlink.

9.2.1.24 MBMS E-RAB Maximum Bit Rate Downlink IE Semantics: Desc.: This IE indicates the maximum downlink MBMS E-RAB Bit Rate (i.e. from the EPC to E-UTRAN) for this bearer. 9.2.1.25 Bit Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the number of bits delivered by E-UTRAN in DL within a period of time, divided by the duration of the period. It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR bearer, or an aggregated maximum bit rate. 9.2.1.25 Bit Rate IE Semantics: The unit is: bit/s

9.2.1.24 MBMS E-RAB Guaranteed Bit Rate Downlink IE Semantics: Desc.: This IE indicates the downlink guaranteed MBMS E-RAB Bit Rate (provided that there is data to deliver) from the EPC to the E-UTRAN for this bearer. 9.2.1.25 Bit Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the number of bits delivered by E-UTRAN in DL within a period of time, divided by the duration of the period. It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR bearer, or an aggregated maximum bit rate. 9.2.1.25 Bit Rate IE Semantics: The unit is: bit/s

9.2.1.26 Allocation and Retention Priority - Section Description: This IE specifies the relative importance of an MBMS E-RAB compared to other MBMS E-RABs for allocation and retention of the MBMS E-RAB.

9.2.1.26 Priority Level IE Semantics: Desc.: This IE should be understood as the “priority of allocation and retention” (see TS 23.246 [6]). Usage: Value 15 means “no priority”. Values between 1 and 14 are ordered in decreasing order of priority, i.e. 1 is the highest and 14 the lowest. Value 0 shall be treated as a logical error if received.
ENUMERATED (shall not trigger pre-emption, may trigger pre-emption)
9.2.1.26 Pre-emption Capability IE Semantics: This IE indicates the pre-emption capability of the request on other MBMS E-RABs.
9.2.1.26 Pre-emption Vulnerability IE Semantics: This IE indicates the vulnerability of the MBMS E-RAB to �ehaviour�n of other MBMS E-RABs.

9.2.3.2 eNB MBMS M2AP ID - Section Description: The eNB MBMS M2AP ID uniquely identifies the MBMS Service association over the M2 interface within the eNB.

9.2.1.7 Criticality Diagnostics - Section Description: The Criticality Diagnostics IE is sent by the eNB or the MCE when parts of a received message have not been comprehended or were missing, or if the message contained logical errors. When applicable, it contains information about which Ies were not comprehended or were missing. For further details on how to use the Criticality Diagnostics IE, (see section 10 in TS 36.413 [4]).

section_list.name: MBMS SERVICE COUNTING REQUEST
aoa:
This message is sent by the MCE to request the eNB to report the number of connected mode Ues that are receiving or interested in the MBMS service(s).
Direction: MCE ? eNB.
9.2.1.1 Message Type - Section Description: The Message Type IE uniquely identifies the message being sent. It is mandatory for all messages.
CHOICE (Initiating Message, Successful Outcome, Unsuccessful Outcome, …)

9.2.1.19 MCCH Update Time - Section Description: This IE indicates the time at which the eNB shall apply the update of the MCCH as specified in TS 36.300 [3]. 9.2.1.19 MCCH Update Time IE Semantics: This IE indicates the modification period, as an absolute value, from when the MCCH update should be applied. Note: The duration of the modification period is configured in eNB and MCE. 8.11 MBMS Service Counting 8.11.2 Successful Operation After receiving the MBMS SERVICE COUNTING REQUEST message successfully, the eNB shall respond the MCE with the MBMS SERVICE COUNTING RESPONSE message, apply the MCCH update from the modification period defined in the MCCH Update Time IE, and perform counting as specified in TS 36.300 [3].
9.2.1.14 MBSFN Area Id - Section Description: This IE defines the MBSFN Area Id. 9.2.1.14 MBSFN Area Id IE Semantics: The same encoding as the mbsfn-AreaId IE specified in TS 36.331 [11].

8.11 MBMS Service Counting 8.11.4 Abnormal Conditions If the eNB has received a MBMS SERVICE COUNTING REQUEST message for a MBSFN Area ID and MCCH Update Time pair, the eNB shall ignore subsequent MBMS SERVICE COUNTING REQUEST messages containing the same MBSFN Area ID and MCCH Update Time, and a different MBMS Counting Request Session IE.
9.2.3.3 TMGI - Section Description: The TMGI uniquely identifies the MBMS Bearer Service.

9.2.3.7 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.3.7 PLMN identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The Selected PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).

section_list.name: MBMS SERVICE COUNTING FAILURE
aoa:
This message is sent by the eNB to report the unsuccessful outcome of the request from the MBMS SERVICE COUNTING REQUEST message.
Direction: eNB ? MCE.
9.2.1.1 Message Type - Section Description: The Message Type IE uniquely identifies the message being sent. It is mandatory for all messages.
CHOICE (Initiating Message, Successful Outcome, Unsuccessful Outcome, …)
9.2.1.2 Cause - Section Description: The purpose of the Cause IE is to indicate the reason for a particular event for the M2AP protocol.

ENUMERATED (Unknown or already allocated MCE MBMS M2AP ID, Unknown or already allocated eNB MBMS M2AP ID, Unknown or inconsistent pair of MBMS M2AP IDs, Radio resources not available, Interaction with other procedure, Unspecified, …, Invalid QoS combination, Not supported QCI value)

ENUMERATED (Transfer Syntax Error, Abstract Syntax Error (Reject), Abstract Syntax Error (Ignore and Notify), Message not Compatible with Receiver State, Semantic Error, Abstract Syntax Error (Falsely Constructed Message), Unspecified, …)
ENUMERATED (Control Processing Overload, Hardware Failure, O&M Intervention, Unspecified, …)

9.2.1.7 Criticality Diagnostics - Section Description: The Criticality Diagnostics IE is sent by the eNB or the MCE when parts of a received message have not been comprehended or were missing, or if the message contained logical errors. When applicable, it contains information about which Ies were not comprehended or were missing. For further details on how to use the Criticality Diagnostics IE, (see section 10 in TS 36.413 [4]).

9.2.1.7 Procedure Code IE Semantics: Procedure Code is to be used if Criticality Diagnostics is part of Error Indication procedure, and not within the response message of the same procedure that caused the error.
ENUMERATED (initiating message, successful outcome, unsuccessful outcome)
9.2.1.7 Triggering Message IE Semantics: The Triggering Message is used only if the Criticality Diagnostics is part of Error Indication procedure.
9.2.1.7 Procedure Criticality IE Semantics: This Procedure Criticality is used for reporting the Criticality of the Triggering message (Procedure).
9.2.1.7 IE Criticality IE Semantics: The IE Criticality is used for reporting the criticality of the triggering IE. The value ‘ignore’ shall not be used.
9.2.1.7 IE ID IE Semantics: The IE ID of the not understood or missing IE.

section_list.name: MBMS SERVICE COUNTING RESULTS REPORT
aoa:
This message is sent by the eNB to report the number of connected mode Ues that are receiving or interested in the MBMS service(s) as indicated in the MBMS SERVICE COUNTING REQUEST message.
Direction: eNB?MCE.
9.2.1.1 Message Type - Section Description: The Message Type IE uniquely identifies the message being sent. It is mandatory for all messages.
CHOICE (Initiating Message, Successful Outcome, Unsuccessful Outcome, …)
9.2.1.14 MBSFN Area Id - Section Description: This IE defines the MBSFN Area Id. 9.2.1.14 MBSFN Area Id IE Semantics: The same encoding as the mbsfn-AreaId IE specified in TS 36.331 [11].
9.2.3.3 TMGI - Section Description: The TMGI uniquely identifies the MBMS Bearer Service.

9.2.3.7 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.3.7 PLMN identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The Selected PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).

9.2.1.21 Counting Result - Section Description: This IE defines the number of connected mode Ues that are receiving or interested in a MBMS service. 9.2.1.21 Counting Result IE Semantics: This IE indicates the number of connected mode Ues that are receiving or interested in a MBMS service. The value 1023 is used if the UE number is equal to or more than 1023.

aoa:
The Criticality Diagnostics IE is sent by the eNB or the MCE when parts of a received message have not been comprehended or were missing, or if the message contained logical errors. When applicable, it contains information about which Ies were not comprehended or were missing.
For further details on how to use the Criticality Diagnostics IE, (see section 10 in TS 36.413 [4]).

9.2.1.7 Procedure Code IE Semantics: Procedure Code is to be used if Criticality Diagnostics is part of Error Indication procedure, and not within the response message of the same procedure that caused the error.
ENUMERATED (initiating message, successful outcome, unsuccessful outcome)
9.2.1.7 Triggering Message IE Semantics: The Triggering Message is used only if the Criticality Diagnostics is part of Error Indication procedure.
9.2.1.7 Procedure Criticality IE Semantics: This Procedure Criticality is used for reporting the Criticality of the Triggering message (Procedure).
9.2.1.7 IE Criticality IE Semantics: The IE Criticality is used for reporting the criticality of the triggering IE. The value ‘ignore’ shall not be used.
9.2.1.7 IE ID IE Semantics: The IE ID of the not understood or missing IE.

section_list.name: Global eNB ID
aoa: This information element is used to globally identify an eNB (see TS 36.401 [2]).

9.2.3.7 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.3.7 PLMN identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The Selected PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).
9.2.1.10 Macro eNB ID IE Semantics: Equal to the 20 leftmost bits of the Cell Identity IE contained in the E-UTRAN CGI IE (see section 9.2.1.11) of each cell served by the eNB.
9.2.1.10 Short Macro eNB ID IE Semantics: Equal to the 18 leftmost bits of the Cell Identity IE contained in the E-UTRAN CGI IE (see section 9.2.1.11) of each cell served by the eNB.
9.2.1.10 Long Macro eNB ID IE Semantics: Equal to the 21 leftmost bits of the Cell Identity IE contained in the E-UTRAN CGI IE (see section 9.2.1.11) of each cell served by the eNB.

section_list.name: E-UTRAN CGI
aoa: This information element is used to globally identify a cell (see TS 36.401 [2]).

9.2.1.11 Cell Identity IE Semantics: The 20 leftmost bits of the Cell Identity correspond to the eNB ID (Global eNB ID IE defined in section 9.2.1.10).

9.2.1.23 GBR QoS Information IE Semantics: This IE applies to GBR bearers only and shall be ignored otherwise. 9.2.1.24 GBR QoS Information - Section Description: This IE indicates the maximum and guaranteed bit rates of a GBR bearer for downlink.

9.2.1.24 MBMS E-RAB Maximum Bit Rate Downlink IE Semantics: Desc.: This IE indicates the maximum downlink MBMS E-RAB Bit Rate (i.e. from the EPC to E-UTRAN) for this bearer. 9.2.1.25 Bit Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the number of bits delivered by E-UTRAN in DL within a period of time, divided by the duration of the period. 9.2.1.24 MBMS E-RAB Guaranteed Bit Rate Downlink IE Semantics: Desc.: This IE indicates the downlink guaranteed MBMS E-RAB Bit Rate (provided that there is data to deliver) from the EPC to the E-UTRAN for this bearer. 9.2.1.25 Bit Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the number of bits delivered by E-UTRAN in DL within a period of time, divided by the duration of the period. 9.2.1.26 Priority Level IE Semantics: Desc.: This IE should be understood as the “priority of allocation and retention” (see TS 23.246 [6]). Usage: Value 15 means “no priority”. Values between 1 and 14 are ordered in decreasing order of priority, i.e. 1 is the highest and 14 the lowest. Value 0 shall be treated as a logical error if received.
ENUMERATED (shall not trigger pre-emption, may trigger pre-emption)

9.2.1.27 Subframe Allocation Info Expanded IE Semantics: The same encoding as the sf-AllocInfo-r16 IE in the mcch-Config-r16 IE as specified in TS 36.331 [11].
9.2.1.27 Modulation and Coding Scheme IE Semantics: The same encoding as the signallingMCS-r16 IE in the mcch-Config-r16 IE as specified in TS 36.331 [11].
9.2.1.27 Subcarrier Spacing MBMS Expanded IE Semantics: The same encoding as the subcarrierSpacingMBMS-r16 IE in the mcch-Config-r16 IE as specified in TS 36.331 [11].
9.2.1.27 Time separation IE Semantics: The same encoding as the timeSeparation-r16 IE in the mcch-Config-r16 IE as specified in TS 36.331 [11].
9.2.1.11 E-UTRAN CGI - Section Description: This information element is used to globally identify a cell (see TS 36.401 [2]).

9.2.3.7 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.3.7 PLMN identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The Selected PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).
9.2.1.11 Cell Identity IE Semantics: The 20 leftmost bits of the Cell Identity correspond to the eNB ID (Global eNB ID IE defined in section 9.2.1.10).

section_list.name: IP Address
aoa: 9.2.2.1 IP Address IE Semantics: This information element is an IP address. The Radio Network Layer is not supposed to interpret the address information. It should pass it to the transport layer for interpretation. For details on the IP Address, see ref. TS 36.445 [13].

section_list.name: GTP-TEID
aoa: 9.2.2.2 GTP TEID IE Semantics: This information element is the GTP Tunnel Endpoint Identifier to be used for the user plane transport between eNB and the MBMS-GW. For details and range, see TS 29.281 [14].

section_list.name: MCE MBMS M2AP ID
aoa: 9.2.3.1 MCE MBMS M2AP ID IE Semantics: The MCE MBMS M2AP ID uniquely identifies the MBMS Service association over the M2 interface within the MCE.

section_list.name: eNB MBMS M2AP ID
aoa: 9.2.3.2 eNB MBMS M2AP ID IE Semantics: The eNB MBMS M2AP ID uniquely identifies the MBMS Service association over the M2 interface within the eNB.

section_list.name: TMGI
aoa: 9.2.3.3 TMGI IE Semantics: The TMGI uniquely identifies the MBMS Bearer Service.

9.2.3.7 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.3.7 PLMN identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The Selected PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).

section_list.name: MBMS Session Identity
aoa: 9.2.3.4 MBMS Session Identity IE Semantics: The MBMS Session Identity identifies the session of an MBMS Bearer Service in E-UTRAN and is used by the UE to recognise repetitions of the session. This IE is transparent to RAN. Coded same way as the MBMS Session Identity IE as defined in TS 29.061 [9].

section_list.name: MBMS Service Area
aoa: 9.2.3.6 MBMS Service Area IE Semantics: The MBMS Service Area IE consists of a list of one or several MBMS Service Area Identities where each MBMS Service Area Identity is frequency agnostic and can be mapped onto one or more cells. Value part coded per MBMS Service Area AVP as defined in TS 29.061 [9].

section_list.name: PLMN Identity
aoa: 9.2.3.7 PLMN identity IE Semantics: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The Selected PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).
